But don’t let his playful antics fool you—Barry has a sweet, affectionate side. Once he’s had his fun, he’s more than happy to settle in next to you for pets and cuddles. He thrives on attention and companionship, making him a wonderful match for someone who enjoys both adventure and downtime.

Barry would love:


An active home where he can run, play, and explore

A family ready to guide his energy with patience and consistency

Plenty of enrichment toys and puzzles to keep his clever mind busy

A comfy spot next to you when it’s time to relax

Barry is ready to bring joy, laughter, and love into his forever home. Could that be with you?

name: Spud
description_html: Spud is a super cute young dog with wrinkles and a curly tail who looks like a Sharpei mixed with a large furry breed. He is a happy, friendly boy who loves to romp around the playyard, tossing around squeaky toys and chasing balls. Spud also entertains himself by jumping in the doggie pool and splashing around in the water. He is especially fun to watch enjoying playtime in the yard. Spud is sweet and affectionate and gently takes treats. He will make a great companion for an active person who enjoys quality time with a young, playful dog.

name: Boogie
description_html:
Meet Boogie! 💙

Say hello to Boogie, the cutest little pittie short stack you’ll ever meet! This pint-sized sweetheart is all about love, snuggles, and living life with a happy heart. Boogie may be small, but his personality is huge — he’s got the perfect mix of mellow and playful.

Boogie is a dream on leash and loves going for walks, exploring the world at an easy pace by your side. When you’re busy, he’s perfectly content entertaining himself with a toy or a cozy nap. He’s also shown great manners with other dogs — he’s a polite “coexistor” who enjoys hanging out without any fuss. And bonus points: Boogie has met a cat and passed his test with flying colors! 🐱

If you’re looking for a cuddly, easygoing companion who will fill your days with warmth and your couch with snuggles, Boogie is your guy. Come meet this lovable shorty — he’s ready to wiggle his way into your heart forever! 💞

If you have any questions, please reach out to orangedotcrew@gmail.com to kickstart this heartwarming journey. For more delightful updates, follow Orange Dot Crew on Facebook and Instagram.

name: Blanca
description_html:
Blanca is the most gentle and sweet cuddle bug! She has only been with me for about two weeks but wow is she lovable! She is amazing with my cat and seems good with smaller dogs but seems pretty reactive when it comes to big dogs. She is very treat motivated, a good listener, great on the leash, eager to adventure, good in the car, and will take every opportunity to give kisses!! She’s been very sleepy with us so far, has spurts of energy if you show her you want to play but seems to want to sleep the day away!


Blanca’s best qualities:

✔ Great living with cats

✔ House-trained

✔ Cuddly + affectionate

✔ Leash-trained

✔ Treat-motivated

✔ Easy-going on walks


Considering adding Blanca to your family? If you have a dog at home, you can set up a behavior-team-supported meet & greet at the shelter to help see whether they’re a good match.


Blanca is sweet, sensitive, and so ready to be someone’s beloved companion. Come meet her — she’ll win you over with one tail wag and a nose boop.

name: Sassy
description_html:
Sassy is a pup who can fit into so many types of homes, and it's truly a mystery why she's been at the shelter as long as she has. She's housetrained, social with other dogs, and such a polite, independent girl. Sassy girl walks nicely on her leash and knows "sit" and "paw." She is very treat motivated and super smart, so it would be pretty easy to train her to do so many fun tricks.


Sassy is a pretty easy going dog who loves puzzle toys and eating tasty things. She might tell you she wants another treat with a "sasy" bark, but we don't imagine she'll be a super loud girl at home. It's just that she knows she's a queen who deserves a soft bed and lots of tasty snacks with a family who loves her.

name: Pop
description_html:
Pop is that dream combo of dog-social, people-friendly, and wonderfully tuned-in to his humans. Out on adventures, he’s polite in the car, easy on leash, and totally down to explore the world with you. And when he lands back home? He turns into the sweetest, cuddliest couch buddy you could ask for.

He’s a sensitive, tender-hearted guy who loves using his brain — offering adorable play bows to show off how smart he is and how happy he feels when you “get” him. In a home, he’s relaxed, gentle, and looks to his person for guidance with those soft, hopeful eyes.

Pop’s Highlights

• Young lab mix with all the lovable lab energy — in a thoughtful package

• Dog-social and polite meeting new friends

• A+ passenger and outing buddy

• House-visiting champ: calm, cuddly, respectful

• Cute sleeper… yes, he naps like an angel

If you’re looking for a loyal companion who will melt your heart daily, Pop is your guy. Reach out to orangedotcrew@gmail.com to kickstart Pop’s heartwarming journey. For more delightful updates, follow Orange Dot Crew on Facebook and Instagram.

name: Marshall
description_html:
Marshall is that perfect mix of mellow and merry. He loves walks where he can take his time sniffing everything, play sessions in the yard, and splashing his paws in the pool before curling up for cuddles.

In playgroup, Marshall is the social type — greeting other dogs with a wag and sometimes getting a little too enthusiastic. He’s easy to divert and his goofy charm always wins everyone back over. Volunteers say he’s a “sweet boy who just wants to be part of the fun.”


This handsome senior is housetrained, affectionate, and ready to trade the noisy kennels for a quiet home and a comfy couch. Stop by to meet him or write his advocates at caring@classiccanines.org with questions.

name: Doobie Dab
description_html:
Meet Doobie!

Doobie is a sweet, sensitive cuddle bug who just wants to be close to his person. He’s a dream on the leash and loves going for relaxed walks around the neighborhood. He's silly and goofy, and loves toys! Doobie already knows several commands — “sit,” “lay down,” and even “night-night” — and he sleeps soundly through the night on his bed.

This smart boy is crate-trained, house-trained, and friendly with other large dogs. He does best with calm, lower-energy pups (too much excitement can overwhelm him), but he enjoys the company of other gentle dogs. Above all, Doobie is a loyal “Velcro dog” who loves being by your side and will quickly become your shadow and best friend.

name: Sandler
description_html:
If Sandler had a dating profile, we're pretty sure it would look something like this: 

About me: Hi there, I'm Sandler! Hoping to find a handsome, playful and cuddly young man you can introduce to your friends and family? Here I am. Seeking someone who shares your passion for an active lifestyle and highly trainable? Ding ding - you found him. Looking for someone who is incredibly good looking with a heart of gold? Look no further. My personality is even better than my handsome looks.

Looking for: I'm in it to win it. I want a lifelong companion. Someone who I can plant roots with (don't worry, I won't dig them up), go on adventures with and grow old with. Already started a family and have kids, the human or furry kind? That won't scare me away. I love other dogs, both male and female and love to play. 

Ideal Date: A long walk or play session in the yard with my toys, taking a quick dip in any body of water, a puddle will do, and then getting loved on by my human. Who of course gives me snacks. To wrap up the date, we'd go back inside and Netflix and Nuzzle. I'll even let you pick the show as long as I can snuggle up, get some scratches and take a cozy snooze.

Think this could be it, the true love you've been looking for? Swipe right, aka come meet me at the shelter today!

name: Angel
description_html: Meet Angel - your future adventure buddy with a heart of gold! Angel is a smart, loyal girl who picks up new things quickly and keeps us smiling with her charming personality. She's housetrained, crate trained, and does well being left alone for a few hours. Like many young dogs, she still has some puppy behaviors-like mouthiness-that she's working on. She's also making great progress with leash reactivity through training and already showing improvement. Angel would thrive in a home with a fenced yard where she can run and play. While she could do well in a family setting, she tends to bond closely with one person and would be an amazing, loyal companion for someone looking for a smart, active partner.

name: Alfie
description_html:
Looking for a loyal companion with a coat as unique as his personality? Say hello to Alfie! This handsome boy sports a truly striking orange brindle pattern that sets him apart from the pack.

Alfie is a well-mannered gentleman. He’s housetrained and a pleasure for brisk walks. If there’s one thing Alfie loves almost as much as his humans, it’s food and treats—making training sessions a breeze! This playful and active boy thrives on an active lifestyle and Alfie is always ready for fun. His loving, energetic nature makes him an ideal addition to a home ready for adventure and endless snuggles. Come meet Alfie and fall in love!

name: Xena
description_html:
Get to know Xena......... a loving brindle babe!


Xena is very smart and quick learner with the help of treats. She knows sit, shake, down, and kisses. Treats and food are big motivators and help to distract her when necessary. She is low to medium energy. She does not bark a lot outside the shelter.


Spending time with Xena outside - She casually strolls on a leash but does get excited when she sees squirrels and lizards. She doesn't seem bothered passing people or other dogs at a distance. She understands "Let's go and This Way" if she gets fixated on things. Expect to see some zoomies in a backyard. She likes to chase soccer balls. She is also happy to sit outside with her human and people watch.


Spending time with Xena inside - She is house trained. She will self-entertain with toys of all kinds, not a picky girl. Give her a smoked beef bone with marrow and she is the happiest dog. Loves, loves, loves belly rubs!!! She is at ease when grooming (bath, nails, and ears).


Xena in the car - She loves car rides and is an excellent passenger. She does not jump over seats in an SUV. She will alternate looking out the window and laying down.


Xena is a great catch! Check her out!

name: Yeti
description_html:
Looking for a calm, cuddly companion? Yeti is your guy! This sweet, gentle, and mellow pup has been at the shelter since July, patiently waiting for his perfect match.


Yeti is very house trained, leash trained, and has the perfect medium energy—always ready for a walk, then a nap and some cuddles. He loves food and treats and enjoys the company of other chill dogs.


Oh, and he’s kind of a star—Yeti made a TV appearance on FOX 7, charming everyone he met!

See the segment here: https://www.fox7austin.com/video/1087057


If you’re looking for a laid-back, loving best friend, Yeti’s your match. Come meet this handsome boy today and see why everyone’s falling for him!

name: Beef
description_html:
Beef is a handsome young pup with cute puppy eyes that show all the love he has to give! Beef loves fun and games; he lives for fetch and a good romp with any ball!


Beef isn't just a playful goofball; he also shows his true gentlemanly side. He's already housetrained and walks like a pro, making him great on a leash. Plus, he's shown to be dog-friendly and done well in playgroups. 


Ready for a devoted, ball-loving companion to bring some joy to your life? Beef is ready for his forever home!


If you have any questions, please reach out to orangedotcrew@gmail.com

name: Sweet Pea
description_html:
Meet Sweet Pea

This cuddler and a charmer is home tested and has all the important skills expected of a mature lady, She's loving, attentive, very housetrained, mannered, rides well in the car. At less than 60 lbs she's smaller statured. She's spayed and heart worm negative and ready to go home right away. .


Sweet Pea prefers not to cohabitate with other pets. Sweet Pea has had some past traumas and being in close proximity to other dogs at the shelter has been very unnerving for her. An ideal setting will be with a loving family in a home setting where she can find her zen. She's so ready for that. Are you ready to meet this pretty lady? Sweet Pea is advocated for by the orangedotcrew@gmail.com - reach out with questions or come by to meet her.

name: Biggie
description_html:
Biggie is a big baby looking for someone to show him that the world isn't such a scary place! He's made great strides, he loves meeting new friends and getting out of his kennel for short walks, but the shelter is just too darn loud and feels scary.


This guy is housetrained and has previous experience living with dogs. He loves to take treats and sit and smile and get his butt scratched. Biggie is a big cuddler looking for a cozy couch and a ticket out of the shelter, where he can settle into a home and start living the life every dog deserves. Come meet this big baby Biggie boy today!

name: Ellie
description_html:
Sweet, silly, and affectionate, Ellie is the most beautiful golden girl looking for a soft place to land and a family to call her own. On the labrador retriever color spectrum, one might say she lands somewhere between "lightly toasted" and "golden." She has the most adorable ears (one that sticks up and the other that flops over) and the cutest docked tail. She is currently housed with an older, mellow dog and a younger, active dog. She is a fantastic dog friend because she knows how to match the energy and respect the boundaries of anyone she plays with. Ellie is house-trained, walks well on leash, and is relatively quiet (not a big barker from what her foster parents can tell). She is non-destructive when left alone in the home, and sleeps well throughout the night. When out and about she has met babies, toddlers, teens, and seniors, and has done well with everyone. Her favorite things include walks, napping, car rides, playing, and belly rubs! If you decide to stop petting her, be prepared for her to ask for "more pets, please!" Ellie is not a fan of rabbits, cats, confining spaces, or loud sudden noises.


Because not a whole lot is known about her past, Ellie can still be shy in new situations and around people she doesn't know. In these situations, usually a high-value treat and a little patience goes a long way to winning her over. Ellie would thrive in a home where she can demand all the belly rubs her heart desires, a doggy (or human) friend, and a cozy place to curl up.


Click "Get Started" to connect with this beautiful pup in person!

name: Sam Winchester
description_html: Sam & Dean Winchester are best buds and they need to be adopted together! These boys are precious as a pair. When walking together they lean into each other and lick each other's faces. They rely on each other for comfort and security. Sam & Dean may get excited in the kennel, but they calm down once out and do their business like champs. They are easy to walk on leash, so don't be shy about taking these boys out. Sam & Dean are ready to meet their new family today!

name: Mae
description_html: Meet Mae! She's a friendly girl who loves a game of fetch. Mae is very friendly once she gets to know you and will climb in your lap for cuddles and pets. 46 pounds isn't too big to be a lap dog, right? We don't think so! Mae gets along well with her current room mate at the shelter, too. She goes potty like a champ outside. What more can you ask for? Adopt Mae today!

name: Dean Winchester
description_html: Sam & Dean Winchester are best buds and they need to be adopted together! These boys are precious as a pair. When walking together they lean into each other and lick each other's faces. They rely on each other for comfort and security. Sam & Dean may get excited in the kennel, but they calm down once out and do their business like champs. They are easy to walk on leash, so don't be shy about taking these boys out. Sam & Dean are ready to meet their new family today!

name: Shamu
description_html: Poblano has been through some tough times and he's not the happiest camper at the shelter. He's lived with other cats before but doesn't seem to enjoy their company, so he would do much better on his own. Poblano can be a hidey cat when he's not feeling brave. He may prefer a calmer home with a cat savvy person to set him up for success. He's not a great fit for small children or dogs. This poor guy could use a place to decompress and get his kitty life back on track!

name: Cooper
description_html:
Cooper is a funny, energetic, and adventurous boy who keeps everyone laughing. On walks, he always finds something like an empty water bottle to crunch and carry for a few feet before dropping it—every time! He loves stuffed toys and will happily entertain himself for as long as you let him.

For handling, Cooper does best with close-in neighbors and a soft toy to hold while harnessing (he’s not interested in treats at that moment). He can be amped up on exit, so treat tosses help him focus moving down the kennel run. Once outside, he may pull at first due to pent-up energy, but he settles nicely when given time to sniff grass, bushes, and trees.

Cooper loves the play yard, especially with toys. Without them, his excitement can turn jumpy. Shelter life is tough for him, and his big feelings sometimes come out as mouthy excitement—having a toy helps him regulate and relax.

name: Sosa
description_html:
Sweet Sosa sees mostly shadows and light but it doesn't stop him from participating in life. He can hear and follow his foster when she calls his name, claps her hands or whistles. He's learned his indoor and outdoor boundaries really well. Each change of living situation will require a short relearning period,


Sosa likes to play with and follow the resident dog who's about the same size and a little younger. Sosa loves squeaky toys and balls, and a roll in the grass, cuddles, belly rubs and even taking a walk in his neighborhood on leash. Sosa has been given access to use the doggie door after learning the outdoor space well, and more impressively, he'll even pick up a toy from living room, walk through doggie door and drop the toy in the backyard all by himself.


Sosa's health needs have been caught up while in foster care. He's even had a dental. An allergy shot helps him stay comfortable during seasonal changes.


It's onward to the best of the rest of his life to a safe, loving home.

Apply on his link to start a conversation with his foster mom.

name: Jojo
description_html: Jojo is a somewhat shy boy (especially with new people), but he doesn't let that stop him from enjoying walks with friends. He walks very well on leash and is easy to direct. His favorite snack might be cat treats. Maybe because of his tiger stripes? Jojo spent a short time in a home with children and enjoyed their company. He may need slow introductions with other dogs until he is feeling confident in a new home. Jojo is well mannered and mellow, a gentle boy who is ready for his home!

name: Jr
description_html:
JR has come a long way since first arriving at the shelter — from a shy, shut-down pup to a gentle, curious companion who’s learning that people can be pretty great.


This shy guy prefers quiet moments, and he’s been making steady progress with patient volunteers. Now, he happily comes forward for walks, enjoys slow laps around the yard, and even offers sweet “nose boops” to his favorite humans in exchange for treats.


JR seems house-trained, food-motivated, and does best when the world moves at his pace. He’s looking for a calm home with understanding people who will give him time to settle in and continue blossoming into a loving dog.

name: Franco
description_html: 🐾 Meet Mr. Franco - Your Gentle Giant in Training! 🐾 Looking for an adolescent pup who's already house, potty, and crate trained? Good with dog-savvy kids? Happy to chill by your side while you work or watch TV? Full of personality and gets along with other dogs? Then Mr. Franco might just be your unicorn! Franco is a big-hearted goofball who doesn't quite realize his own size. He's the perfect mix of cuddly and calm, with bursts of excited energy when it's time to play, especially with people, pups, or when there's food involved. Franco was recently in foster care, where he worked hard on his recall, patience, and manners. Like many tall boys, he's been known to counter-surf, but his foster mom assures us: "We're working on it!" Hand him a toy or a bone, and Franco's in heaven. 🏡 Ideal Home: Franco will thrive in a home that can offer him a balance of activity and downtime-think daily walks or dog park play, followed by some solid couch cuddles. Due to his size and puppy energy, we recommend a home without cats and without very young children, unless they're experienced with dogs.

name: Diamond
description_html: Diamond has a lot of personality filled with wiggles and cuddles! She seems to really enjoy hanging out with her people. She may jump at first greetings because she gets excited, but she calms down once she is out and about on leash. Diamond's favorite things are balls and chew toys! She can keep herself entertained for awhile. She's a snuggler, so expect this girl to keep you company when you need it the most.

name: Mr Kitten
description_html:
Built like a tank but with a heart as squishy as a land manatee, this big blockhead is basically a canine Travis Kelce: charming, incredibly good looking, and impossible not to love.

Mr. Kitten has excellent leash manners and is wonderfully patient with newer volunteers—he’ll let beginners practice harnessing without a fuss. He’s calm and collected walking past kennels or other dogs, taking everything in stride with his signature mellow confidence.

Under that handsome gray coat is the sweetest heart you’ll ever meet. Don’t let his size fool you: he’s a gentle giant through and through. On the leash, he’s a loose-leash pro; off the leash, he becomes the world’s cuddliest couch companion with plenty of surface area for snuggles.

Kind, loving, and endlessly mellow, Mr. Kitten is the dog who wins people over instantly. Come meet him—your only regret will be not doing it sooner.


Additional Foster Notes

Wow, he's amazing! In addition to the notes above, he's not vocal (doesn't bark), doesn't beg for food, allows bathing and grooming, he's potty trained, and does well in crowds with screaming kiddos and music. He's a great car passenger and was fantastic with my 6 year old niece.

name: Jelly
description_html:
A gentle, shy girl with a heart full of love just waiting to bloom, Jelly is a calm, observant pup who feels most at ease in a quiet, low-traffic home - the perfect match for a homebody who enjoys cozy nights in and the occasional walk or adventure. She is house-trained, making her an easy addition to your home.


Jelly finds comfort and confidence around other dogs. She loves playing and cuddling with her foster roommate and would thrive in a home with a friendly canine companion.


When her humans are relaxing, Jelly is right there beside them - peaceful and content. She may take some time to earn your trust, but once she does, she’ll be your loyal little shadow. Her herding instincts make her an attentive, quick learner who would love puzzle toys, enrichment activities, or fun training sessions.


Jelly enjoys running in the backyard and walks beautifully on a leash, calmly minding her own business around other dogs and people. She’s also polite with cats - she simply lets them be.


She’s still learning that chews are hers to enjoy, and her sweet, cautious nature makes every new discovery a joy to witness.


If you’re looking for a gentle soul to share your quiet moments and daily routines, Jelly is ready to melt into your heart and your home.

name: Cornelia
description_html: Cornelia is a little shy with new people but a total goofball once she lets loose. At 1 year old she is still bursting with puppy energy - she loves toys, fetch, and would splash around in some water and run around all day if you'd let her! Looking for a high-energy side-kick to all your adventures? Cornelia is your gal!

name: Nayla
description_html:
Nayla is one special girl who will absolutely steal your heart from the very first hello. She’s friendly, fun, and full of affection, always ready for a splash in the pool or a good game of fetch. But don’t let her playful side fool you—she also knows how to slow down and get super cozy, especially when she’s wrapped up in her favorite blankets, just soaking up all the love from her people.


This sweetheart is house-trained and walks beautifully on a leash, making her an easy companion for both busy days and relaxed evenings. Nayla’s the perfect size for cuddles, adventures, and everything in between.


Her beautiful salt-and-pepper face gives her an undeniable old soul charm, and you can tell she’s patiently waiting to find her forever family—the perfect match who will cherish her just as much as she will them.


If you’re searching for a loyal, loving companion who thrives on connection and cuddles, Nayla might just be the one to fill your life with joy and warmth.

name: Nellie
description_html:
Fluffy former teen mom and handsome future house panther kitten seek home together... 1 year old Nellie and 6 month old Yule have bonded quickly in their foster home.

Yule is a patient, gentle, playful boy who brought fearful but sweet Nellie out of hiding with his adorable antics. She joins him in daily games of chase, stalk the fly and their joint favorite: foster-mom-wand-acrobatics.

Yule is an expert cuddler and loves to sleep politely at the foot of the bed with his foster mom. Nellie enjoys pets in her own bed (purrs like a champ) and relaxes there with her fluffy feet hanging out. They share a litter-box and have perfect litter-box habits. They also love their cardboard scratchers.

Nellie and Yule are a truly joyful pair!

The adoption fee is waived for Nellie, Yule, and all Desperate Housecats!

name: Jack
description_html:
Say hello to Jack! This striking, chocolate-colored pup is a delightful mix of playful and calm energy. Jack is a smart cookie who absolutely loves food and treats! He's always up for a good walk and romp in the yard, but he's also happy to settle down for a relaxing afternoon. He is an affectionate guy who loves to give and receive affection.  

With his beautiful amber eyes and friendly demeanor, Jack is ready to bring his loving, well-mannered self into your heart and home.

name: Cyber
description_html:
Cyber is what dog volunteers lovingly refer to as a “pre-programmed puppy”. She’s leash trained and loves to give nose boops while walking. In the car she hops right in and is calm and quiet. She knows sit, down, and roll over and would love to add to her resume if it means getting more treats.


Cyber is that sweet spot of great at self entertaining (give her allll the stuffies) but also likes to have fun playing fetch with her human pals. She loves kiddie pools but feels meh about pools.


Our little lady is also very cuddly! Belly rubs, rubbing against your leg like a cat, or asking for back scratches, she’s here for it all.


Did you know she also loves to show off her tricks? "Sit", "Shake", "Down", and "Roll Over" - She has mastered them all!


She’s a puppy her friends refuse to let grow up in the shelter. She’s been going on some field trips with her friends and having a blast. Come meet this little lady- and bring treats!

name: Tea
description_html:
Yerba and Tea came in as silly little stray scaredy kittens. They are on a journey of self-reflection. Their goal is to be braver with people! Yerba and Tea enjoy play time with wand toys, and though they may take some time to warm up to new people, we think they will reach their goal sooner than later. They may do best in a calm home with a cat friend to learn from and a patient adopter to help them on their journey.


Yerba and Tea are now a part of our Cactus Cat program for shy cats who need a little help from volunteers. They don't have to go home together, but do enjoy each other's company.


I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage!


The adoption fee is waived for Tea and all Cactus Cats/Desperate Housecats!

name: Yerba
description_html:
Yerba and Tea came in as silly little stray scaredy kittens. They are on a journey of self-reflection. Their goal is to be braver with people! Yerba and Tea enjoy play time with wand toys, and though they may take some time to warm up to new people, we think they will reach their goal sooner than later. They may do best in a calm home with a cat friend to learn from and a patient adopter to help them on their journey. Yerba and Tea are now a part of our Cactus Cat program for shy cats who need a little help from volunteers. They don't have to go home together, but do enjoy each other's company.


I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage!


The adoption fee is waived for Yerba and all Cactus Cats/Desperate Housecats!

name: Hank
description_html: Hank is such a lovable guy! He's full of energy and loves zooming around the backyard, playing tug of war, and keep away games. But he also knows how to kick back and relax-whether he's lounging on the floor or curled up in his cozy bed. Hank's pretty smart too-he can sit, lie down, roll over, and shake. He's still learning how to walk nicely on a leash, but he's eager to improve. Overall, Hank's a sweet goofball who just needs a wonderful home to share his love!

name: Tom Pitty
description_html:
Free fall into love with Tom Pitty!  


This heartbreaker is 2 years young, full of joy and has eyes that you can get lost in.  He's runnin' down a dream that he'll find his forever family soon, and isn't backing down until he meets his perfect match. Qualities must include: likes to share their peanut butter, enjoys long walks where he can stop and smell the wildflowers, will drive during long car rides listening to 80s rock, and must love afternoon naps on the couch. But don’t worry, Tom Pitty always brings something to the party.


He knows love is a long road, and is looking for someone who's in it for the long haul. Nick-named the "Happiest Boy at the Shelter" by his volunteer friends, he's known for always having a smile on his face!


Don’t be just another face in the crowd, send us an email today and we can help you meet him!

 blueplusbusters@gmail.com

name: Gus
description_html:
Gus' foster says: "Gus is a sweet, young, chill, and friendly boy. He is good on walks and totally crate trained. He is in obedience training now and doing great! Sit, stay, leave it, etc.

He is good with dogs – my older pups tell him off occasionally for being rambunctious, and he takes it in stride and gives them some space. He is a lovable, funloving guy and is even learning to get along with my cat."

name: Petey
description_html:
Petey is a little guy with a big heart. He loves his people and would love nothing more than a house with lots of toys and a spot on the couch. Or, the floor. Or anywhere. Petey is known to be able to fall asleep on any surface and in any position. But, his favorite spot will always be near his people.


Petey walks great on a leash and can self entertain with toys. He seems to prefer chewing on hard toys but would probably enjoy a variety. He loves to be pet and gets occasional zoomies. A volunteer who took him on an outing to her home noted that he loves car rides and curled up immediately and fell asleep in the backseat. She also gave him up a thumbs up for no accidents in the house and very polite manners. He won’t get on the couch unless invited.


Petey has lived with another dog at the shelter and is known as a co-exister in play group. He could go home with a well-matched dog after a meet and greet.


Whether he’s an only pet or is joining your pack, Petey will be a sweet and gentle companion who would love to fall asleep in your lap.

name: Stir Fry
description_html:
Stir Fry has the joyful heart of a child who lives to play! His favorite toy is a tennis ball, and his favorite game is batting it around to chase. When Stir Fry’s not busy entertaining himself with a ball, he loves to sniff the world around him on a walk. The only thing he asks for is some personal space on his walks - he’s not always sure if strangers are friendly or not, and he prefers to play it safe. 


Stir Fry has demonstrated that he is extremely house trained and is always anxiously waiting to go potty as soon as he is out of his kennel. He loves treats (meaty or cheesy, he says!) and will gladly sit for them. Stir Fry also loves going to play group with his doggy friends, so if you’re looking to add someone to your pack, you can set up a Meet & Greet for your resident pup and Stir Fry. This guy is ready for a life of love and play time!

name: Ravioli
description_html:
Meet Ravioli, a lovely shepherd who is as scrumptious as his name! At first glance, his most striking feature is his wide, infectious smile, which he carries everywhere, an indicator of his sunny disposition and zest for life.

Ravioli is a fantastic companion for brisk walks and hanging around the house. He absolutely loves fetch and chasing balls, and is getting quite good at it! He’s also housetrained and respectful of his indoor space. He also loves splashing around in the kiddie pool and bringing his toys and balls with him into the water for extra fun.  

While he is a spirited and playful adventurer, Ravioli transforms into the ultimate cuddler once the day’s activities are done. He loves nothing more than to curl up close and share quiet time with his favorite person. He loves a back scratch and will cozy up right against you. Give Ravioli a squeaky toy, a long walk, and a good cuddle, and you’ll receive unending joy in return!

name: Haiyan
description_html:
Haiyan is an adorable deaf puppy with a heart full of love and a tail that never stops wagging! This playful little guy is dog-social, always up for a game of chase or a cuddle session with a furry friend. His joyful spirit and irresistible cuteness make him an instant favorite with everyone he meets.

Being in the shelter is tough for a puppy like Haiyan—he’s ready for a cozy home, a warm bed, and someone to show him the ropes. Because he’s deaf, he’ll need a bit of patience and guidance as he learns the world in his own way, but he’s already full of curiosity and happiness.

Haiyan would thrive in a home with another friendly dog to help show him the ropes, and a family who’s ready to love him just as he is. Could you be the soft place this sweet pup has been waiting for?

If you have any questions, please reach out to orangedotcrew@gmail.com to kickstart this heartwarming journey. For more delightful updates, follow Orange Dot Crew on Facebook and Instagram.

name: Thalia
description_html: Thalia might be the snuggliest on site. She will roll around in your lap until every body part is rubbed and kissed. She is a people lover and happy girl. She has a gorgeous smile and upbeat personality. She likes to play and bounce around but would prefer to wiggle on top of you or next to you. This is why the lap is her favorite.

name: Buddy
description_html: Meet Buddy, a very respectful young (1.5 year old) boy now living with a 17lb doddle mix and a 40lb lab mix. Though he likes being around his dog companions he really enjoys being around kids playing outside. Game of fetch or just about any other game is ok with Buddy. Inside, he is calm and surrounds himself with as many squeak toys as possible. Though a young boy, he spends most of the day chilled with afternoons reserved for a long siesta. No problems with deer just outside the fence but the occasional squirrel will grab his attention. Though Buddy spends most of the day inside given the high outdoor temps, in the evening and early morning he enjoys being outside watching the world pass. The highlight of the day is his walk. His lease etiquette is being worked on but drastically improved over a short period of time (about 70% there). Buddy understands and obeys basic commands (stay, sit, laydown, off). If he does become excited inside, a simple command to laydown works every time. He is very respectful of the two other dogs living in the house even the little one who often try's to dominate. Too, it's amazing how little he sheds, especially compared to the other two we have but this could change throughout the year. Overall a very obedient calm boy who would love to have someone to play or spend time outside.

name: Jorge
description_html: You've got to meet Jorge, the guy with TONS of personality! A former community cat, he is no stranger to human companionship. He's being treated for skin allergies, and is so friendly that he deserves an indoor home. Jorge loves to be petted, and likes being near his peeps (he'll sit beside you). He's very social, and doesn't seem to have ever met a stranger. He may get along with other cats, and would love to be in a real home, either through adoption or through foster! I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage: http://www.desperatehousecats.info/flyers/Jorge14095.pdf The adoption fee is waived for Jorge and all Desperate Housecats!

name: Capri
description_html:
Meet Capri — the sweetheart waiting to steal your heart.

Capri walks right beside you on a loose leash like he’s always known you. He loves to munch on a toy while getting back scratches and will happily lean in for cuddles and neck rubs.

Playful and affectionate, Capri enjoys time in the yard as much as he likes snuggling with you on the couch.

With his adorable markings, gentle personality, and endless love to give, Capri is the perfect companion for someone looking for a loyal, snuggly friend.

name: Marvin
description_html:
Marvin is a great dog! Besides being a handsome fellow, he is very house trained, easy to walk on leash, friendly and playful. Marvin loves to romp around the play yard, chasing balls and tossing his toys. He is dog social and enjoys running along the fence line playing with other friendly dogs. Marvin is treat motivated, promptly sits on command and gently takes treats. He was also recently cat tested and passed with flying colors!


Marvin also has a softer side and is a quiet, affectionate young boy who enjoys cuddle time with his person. He will make a wonderful companion in a loving home.


Come meet sweet Marvin, and take home your new best friend!

name: Scooby
description_html:
Scooby arrived as a puppy and is still figuring out the whole “being a dog” thing — and it’s honestly adorable to watch. He’s curious, bright, and taking in the world one new experience at a time.

Even though he’s still learning the ropes, Scooby is quick, eager to please, and motivated to get it right. With some patience, consistency, and love, he’s going to grow into an incredible companion — you can already see the potential shining through.

If you love the idea of shaping a young, smart pup and watching him blossom, Scooby is ready for his person to come cheer him on.

name: Pat
description_html:
Pat is a 35-lb sweetheart with a goofy personality and the softest soul. He can be a little shy at first, but once he knows he’s safe, he warms up quickly and lets his silly side shine. His favorite activities include backyard chase (with kisses once he catches you), cozy snuggles, chew toys, booty scratches, and—of course—cheese.


As a young puppy, Pat is still learning good house manners. He’s curious and likes to explore, but he’s not destructive and responds well to gentle correction and redirection. At this stage, he does best with supervision rather than free roaming, and he settles nicely in his crate when it’s time to relax.


Pat is the perfect balance of playful and calm. He enjoys playtime but is also very happy to relax and cuddle with his people.


He’s done great with other dogs—at the shelter, he shared a kennel and participated successfully in playgroups. In his foster home, he’s seen the resident cats and has shown very little interest. While slow introductions are still recommended, he’s showing great potential to be cat-friendly.


Pat’s highlights:

    •    🐶 Dog-friendly

    •    🏡 Fully potty trained

    •    💤 ~80% crate trained (settles easily with minimal whining)

    •    🦮 Walks nicely on leash with little pulling

    •    ⚡ Medium energy — playful but loves downtime

    •    💕 Affectionate, gentle, and people-oriented


Pat is a little bigger than a beagle and likely won’t get much bigger, making him a great fit for apartments or homes of any size. He’s still building confidence and would thrive with adopters who appreciate a sweet, sensitive dog and are excited to help him continue blossoming.


Adoption info:

Pat is currently in a foster home if you’re interested in meeting him, please submit an adoption application. 


After submitting an application his foster mom will reach out to schedule a meet-and-greet so you can spend time together and see if he’s the right fit for your home. A meet-and-greet is not a commitment, and scheduling is flexible.


So go ahead, apply and meet the little guy! :)

name: Rabbit
description_html:
Rabbit is a shy guy who loves the company of other cats! He especially enjoys playtime and cuddles with feline friends. He came in with several litter mates, but due to their overwhelming shyness, they have pretty much grown up at the shelter. He may need extra attention and guidance in a new home as he gradually settles in. Rabbit may do best in a home with a social cat to show him "how to cat" with humans and how to be brave. Meet this special guy today!

I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage!

The adoption fee is waived for Rabbit and ALL Cactus Cats/Desperate Housecats!

name: Frog
description_html:
Frog was brought to AAS with his cat buddies after their owner moved and left them behind. He is a member of our Cactus Cats program, and is receiving confidence boosting through clicker training.

Frog is playful, and interactive play is a great way to make friends with him. He is very shy, and tends to hide, or to run when you approach him.

Frog needs a cat savvy adopter who will give him the time he needs to continue his confidence building journey. He also needs a cat friend in his new home.

I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage!

The adoption fee is waived for Frog and ALL Cactus Cats/Desperate Housecats!

name: Grr
description_html:
Meet Grr 🐈‍⬛


Grr came into Spicewood Springs Cat Hospital’s care when her owner could no longer look after her due to health complications. They have spent the past few months helping Grr adjust to a very big life change—and she’s now ready for her next chapter.


She’s mastered office kitty life and is officially ready for bigger and better things! Grr may be slow to warm up, but once she feels safe, she’s incredibly affectionate, cuddly, and playful. She’ll likely do best in a quiet home without children or other pets.


When Grr finds her person, she’ll be a loyal confidant for life. 🖤

name: Micky
description_html: This gentle puppy is shy at first, but just takes a minute to open up and be his sweet, silly self. He's wiggly and happy. He's playful and adorable.

name: Mr. Shrimp
description_html:
Meet Mr. Shrimp 🐾

The Brave, Cuddly Companion You've Been Waiting For

Mr. Shrimp might have a silly name, but this young pup is all heart and courage. When he first arrived at the shelter, he was completely shut down — scared, unsure, and desperate for comfort. He didn’t want anyone to leave his side, clinging to human connection as his anchor in a confusing world.

But oh, how far he’s come.

Thanks to patience, love, and his own incredible spirit, Mr. Shrimp's confidence has bloomed. He’s now a playful, affectionate, and curious companion who checks in often to make sure he’s being the very best boy. Whether it’s cuddling close, romping around with toys, or soaking up praise for his leash manners, he’s all about making you smile.

Mr. Shrimp is also impressively house trained and eager to learn the ropes of life outside the shelter. He’s the kind of dog who makes you feel special, just by choosing to trust you.

This brave little guy is ready for his next adventure — could it be with you?

If you have any questions, please reach out to orangedotcrew@gmail.com to kickstart this heartwarming journey. For more delightful updates, follow Orange Dot Crew on Facebook and Instagram.

name: Tiger
description_html: Tiger’s foster says: "Tiger is a really sweet cuddly guy. He is wonderful with all people. He is really sweet with kids. We have a five-year-old who has tested this extensively and I’ve never even seen him nip at her or even growl. He has some leash reactivity with other dogs sometimes but he doesn’t always bark at all dogs. I have not socialized him with other dogs so I’m not sure that going to a dog park or a heavily dog trafficked area would be a good idea for him. He is really a sweet, sweet, loving guy."

name: Disco
description_html: Per Disco's previous foster: Disco is a sweet, smart & lovable 1.5 year old pup who can be energetic and playful yet mellow when just hanging out. He is crate & potty trained, and does very well just sitting on the porch or while we watch tv! He's very well behaved, knows "sit", "down", "stay", & "place" (his crate & bed). He loves tug of war, hide & seek, and long morning & evening walks. Still a young pup, he needs long walks & play time to tire out his mind & body - we've been walking around 3-4 miles a day! Although he does get very excited on walks & pulls a bit to sniff all the smells, & play with all the dogs (usually he can walk past with some peaked interest, but sometimes he does get real excited and itches to play with a very light whine and jump - were working on his focus & distractions with treats + positive reinforcement when he looks up at us or checks in) with some consistent training & socialization I'm certain he'd keep his attention at bay in no time! Despite his happy go lucky spirit, Disco also knows how to chill at home. He's easy to get in his crate, will sleep next to you for hours during a mellow day, and overall just loves laying down close to people. He's just about 50lbs and shouldn't grow much more, so he's perfect to take in the car (his car manners are perfect) and on adventures! Disco would be a wonderful fit for an active home willing to dedicate some time towards cuddles, tug-of-war, + a little bit of discipline & consistency!

name: Bubbles
description_html:
Bubbles buckled in for a family experience as she went to her foster home.

Using equal parts playful and cuddler spirit, she has proven herself to be a fun and supportive companion for her people and dog friends.


She's also a road warrior, having spent time sharing RV space with her foster family while traveling.


Reach out to learn more about how she'll do as a member of your family.


She's advocated for by her fosters, friends and fans including ClassicCaninesATX who go the extra mile for the mature dog crowd, whether they want to act their age or not :) Bubbles is spayed, vaccinated and has had a fresh dental. caring@classiccanines.org

name: Homer
description_html:
Bringing in a Homer

Homer arrived stray and a little depleted from his adventures. He's been in a foster home getting rested and recharged where he enjoys the company of his fosters and their dog. He's been a great house guest, house trained, loves his walks and loves catching a little play action whether wriggling in the grass on his back or with his canine friend.


He's reaching his goal weight and has been neutered. Now his heartworm status is being addressed with a completion date in February. His medical care as a foster dog has been sponsored by his advocates at ClassicCaninesATX. An adopter will also receive a buffer of initial services including a $150 veterinary care credit for future services at their preferred vet clinic, along with a $100 gift card for initial supplies. It's just one way to help keep the focus where it belongs, on the transition of a deserving reconditioned mature dog to a loving and safe home, without breaking the bank.


If you're interested in adoption, reach out on his link to get connected with his foster providers.

name: Kalamazoo
description_html:
Kalamazoo is ready to charm his way into your heart. His most distinguishing feature? Those absolutely iconic ears that give him a truly unique and lovable look!

More than just looks, Kalamazoo is a sweetheart through and through. This dog-experienced youngster loves to cuddle and is incredibly affectionate, soaking up every pet you can offer. He's a dream on walks—easy on a leash—and housetrained. His favorite pastimes include splashing in a kiddie pool and playing, especially tug of war with a rope. If you're looking for a sweet, ready-to-love companion, Kalamazoo is available and waiting to be yours!

name: Toast Tina
description_html:
Sweet 3-year-old “mini” German Shepherd


Walks nicely on a leash


Treat-motivated and eager to please


Loves cuddles and human attention


Medium energy — great balance of play and chill time

name: Prince Eric
description_html:
Prince Eric is a handsome, cuddly German Shepherd available to adopt or foster at Austin Animal Services. This cutie is basically a big puppy and loves to be near his human. He’s playful and loves to chase toys around the yard.  He’s also so easy on a leash and walks wonderfully.

Prince Eric is just like the character from The Little Mermaid; he is ready for adventure, a total romantic, and has a kind and sensitive nature.  Ready to bring this sweet boy home?  Come meet him today!

name: Rebby
description_html:
Rebby is an active pup, who loves to play fetch and tug of war. Smart and food motivated, Rebby is easy to train and really wants to make his person happy. He needs lots of mental and physical exercise. 


He loves adults and is very keen on staying near his person. He is a cuddler, and wants to lay on or by you all the time. 

While he likes teenagers, younger children are new and he can be fearful. He also needs time to warm up to new dogs. 


He can be very protective of his person, so socialization and training are keys to making him a well rounded dog. 


While he has not met any cats, he has a low prey so would likely do well in a home with cats if introduced slowly and carefully. 


He will be a large dog.

name: Bambino
description_html:
Meet Bambino! 🐾

This handsome 2-year-old boy is absolutely thriving in foster care and ready to find his forever home! Bambino is as sweet and affectionate as they come. He is truly a big baby who loves cuddles and playtime equally.


Bambino is a perfect house guest: quiet, well-mannered, and fully crate and house trained. He’s also a quick learner and a great listener!


Bambino adores his foster sister Koda, a playful 2.5-year-old pit mix and loves his toys. He’s friendly with new people and working on handling living downtown like a pro. He has been going on trail walks and is getting experience passing lots of other dogs in high-traffic situations living in a high-rise.


Bambino would thrive in a home either with or without another pet and fill your days with love, laughter, and loyalty. 💛

name: Henrietta
description_html:
Henrietta is a loving pup who truly just wants people to love her as much as she loves them!


This girl gets an A+ in all the areas!


  • Housetrained
  • People's best friend
  • Loves toys
  • Loves to romp around with other dogs!
  • Cuddly
  • Fantastic at self entertaining with toys - can fit 3 in her mouth at once!
  • Loves to sit with you and people watch
  • The wiggliest of butts
  • Did I mention she loves toys?


She is working hard on her leash skills that are mainly due to her not wanting to go back to kennel to be left alone.


This girl is a family girl without a family. Come meet sweet Henrietta today!

name: Bear
description_html:
Bear is the definition of a "diamond in the rough." After being found dumped on the streets with his brother, Teddy, Bear has spent his time in foster care blossoming into a brilliantly behaved, affectionate, and soulful companion. He is a sensitive soul who is looking for a partner to show him that the world is a safe place. Everyone that meets him comments on how chill he is and how sweet his personality is.


Bear is an absolute gentleman in the home. He is potty trained and crate trained, though he would much prefer to be your "bed hog" if you’ll allow it! He actually jumps into the bathtub by himself and sits patiently for nail trims. He loves car rides and is ready for any road trip.


Bear is incredibly smart and highly food-motivated, which has made training a breeze. He already boasts an impressive resume of commands like: sit, stay, touch, leave it, come, shake, pound it!, lay down, and soon to be much more! He is amazing on a leash.


Because of his rough start, Bear can fearful of new people.. He needs a slow introduction to strangers; while he will bravely take treats and follow commands from new friends, he prefers not to be petted until he knows he can trust you. Once you are in his "inner circle," he is a velcro dog who would follow you to the end of the earth.


Bear’s Ideal Forever Home:

  • Presence: Someone who is home more often than not to give him the reassurance he craves. He'd love to live with another dog(s) to continue to help build his confidence.
  • Patience: A family willing to advocate for his space during introductions.
  • Love: Plenty of couch space for snuggles and pets.
  • Note on Cats & Kids: Bear is looking for a no-cat (ideally) household (though he lives with them at his Foster who can provide further info) and a home without young children, as he prefers a calm, predictable environment.


Bear survived the streets, and now he’s ready to survive a long nap on a soft bed next to his favorite person(s). Is that person you?


Follow Bear’s journey and get to know him better on Instagram: @adopt_bestboybear. You can also check out his brother Teddy who is up for adoption too!

name: Teddy
description_html:
Teddy is a handsome, 40-pound Catahoula mix with a striking dark brown patterned coat and warm amber eyes that will steal your heart. At under two years old, he’s the perfect blend of playful energy and calm affection.

This sweet boy loves to be wherever you are. He will curl up with you on the couch, hang out around the house, or join you on a walk. He enjoys running around the yard and plays wonderfully with his foster dog sibling. Teddy already knows how to sit and is working on lay/stay. He is eager to please (especially if treats are involved!).

Teddy’s favorite thing in the world is being close to his people. If you’re looking for a loyal companion who will shower you with love, follow you from room to room, and make every day brighter, Teddy is your guy!

name: Cleocatra
description_html: Cleocatra will mesmerize you with her golden eyes! She's affectionate and loves petting. She also gives excellent elevator butt. Cleocatra will show you her belly and it's not even a trick! She is so easy going and will make a loving companion cat to some lucky person.

name: Smokie
description_html:
Smokie is as handsome as he is well mannered. He originally came from a breeder and lived with a family (including 4 kiddos) for almost 2 years. When the family moved out of state, he was kept in a friend’s shed until the shelter would take him in.


We’ve learned many things about this very good boy since coming under our care. Besides being house trained and knowing basic commands, he’s also good in the car, leash trained, and is up for any adventure. We’ve had a few field trips with Smokie to the Mueller area. He’s calm and confident and always says thank you for field trips by giving us cuddles.


If you’re looking for a confident and handsome adventure buddy, he’s your boy!

name: Blue
description_html: Blue is having the time of his life in a foster home where he's proven to be a perfect size for his perfectly behaved life in an apartment - he's adapted so well with his smaller frame of about 50 lbs. He's quiet and stays home alone well. He's never destructive. He's easy to manage and easy to love. He loves everyone and passed a short cat test too. He's lived with a female dog sibling before and done very well. What are you waiting for? Your perfect match is right here... His friends at ClassicCaninesATX also have adoption support specials for the rest of 2025. Reach out on his link or write his advocates at caring@classiccanines.org

name: Marley
description_html: Marley is a pint sized, playful girl who loves spending time with people! She's friendly with everyone she meets at the shelter. She likes to bounce her way out of the kennel because she's so excited to leave it! Once outside this affectionate girl enjoys cuddles and play time. Marley lived with another dog at the shelter for a bit so may enjoy the company of another dog at home! We would love to see sweet Marley in foster care if she isn't adopted soon.

name: Loki
description_html:
Loki is a very cute fun puppy. He has some energy and isn't burning it at the shelter, but is delightful in the play yard. He loves chasing toys and getting his zoomies out. He can be a little more excited on leash, but it's nothing crazy. Just toss a toy in front to keep him moving as he learns leash life. He does better after he can burn off his puppiness and will do great in a home that can help him decompress.


"

name: Wrigley
description_html:
Wrigley is the kind of dog who’s impossible not to adore. He’s gentle, sweet, and full of wiggly charm. The moment he steps outside, he happily nudges his head between your legs for pets and affection. He starts his walks with some excitement (he’s just so thrilled to be out!), but quickly settles into a loose-leash stroll and checks in often. Volunteers describe him as an easy, loving companion who’s just happy to be by your side.


Wrigley does well with most dogs who share his soft, gentle play style. He also thrives in a home setting, where he shows off his goofy, playful side. Though he isn’t especially treat-motivated, his eagerness to connect with people makes him a joy to work with. He does have a high prey drive, so he’ll need supervision when wildlife is around and may be best suited to a home without cats or other small animals.

name: Radar
description_html:
Meet Radar!


We don't know much about Radar's past, as he was abandoned on campus one day with 4 of his siblings. Since then he's been a little shy but is starting to warm up!


On leash, Radar is a relaxed walker who enjoys moving at a comfortable pace, taking frequent sniff breaks to explore his surroundings. He’s perfectly content with a shorter walk and loves to “check in” with you along the way, offering plenty of adorable nose boops.


In a house setting Radar enjoys exploring and engaging his brain. Snuffle mats are a favorite, and he clearly enjoys enrichment activities. When it comes to toys, he’s enthusiastic but polite—if you toss one, he’ll happily run to grab it, drop it right away, then turn and wait patiently for you to pick it up and throw it again. He is non-destructive!


The play yard is where Radar truly shines. He comes out of his shell and loves chasing balls and toys. He is fantastic at fetch, where he will bring the ball back, drop it at your feet, and back up a few steps giving you space to pick up the ball and throw it again! He also enjoys running around and sniffing, fully taking in the environment with confidence and curiosity.


Come meet Radar today!

name: Abner
description_html:
Abner is a handsome and sweet dog who is ready to steal your heart! This stunning boy has a truly unforgettable look, thanks to his striking eyes—one bright blue and one warm brown. His unique gaze perfectly matches his wonderful personality. 

On a walk, Abner is a dream, demonstrating excellent manners and staying easy on the leash. When it's time to play, he's energetic and engaging, but he settles down just as quickly for some quality snuggle time. Above all, Abner is affectionate and believes there is no problem a good, long belly rub can't solve. If you're looking for a playful, loving companion with an undeniably captivating look, Abner is the perfect match!

name: Nova
description_html:
Nova was surrendered due to their owner's living arrangement changing. She's Smart, loyal, sweet, and playful. She's a very good girl for baths, too! Nova's favorite things are taking walks with her people, chasing balls, playing with squeaky toys, and enjoying a chew toy. Nova has lived with small and large dogs previously. She's awaiting her new home today!


From her foster parents:


Nova is an extremely sweet and curious dog who loves to be involved in every single conversation and is always eager to receive cuddles and praise. She loves eating kibbles and will drink lots of water when she's thirsty after long walks! She can be a little picky about her treats – for instance, she does not love peanut butter treats so you may need to experiment. Nova is shockingly tolerating of baths, but she does not love getting her paws and eyes cleaned.


Nova loves running after balls but does not yet know how to retrieve them (maybe you can teach her!). She loves cars and car rides, and she is learning not to jump and lick when she is excited (to see you!). She may proudly carry your socks to you as a gift, and we still don't know why! She loves to sleep with you but can be trained not to if you don't want her on the bed. She is a little apprehensive of kids and may bark if they get too close. Nova is also protective of you and will bark at strangers in your home, but she becomes friendly when you tell her it's okay. She cares a lot about her people and will run over to help if you seem unwell.


Nova loves going on walks but is also very happy to stay home (where she naps and plays). She will run over and sit whenever she hears you pick up the leash! She is also really good at 'sit', especially if you have treats. She is super smart, so with lots of praises and treats, she can learn many more commands! She is very curious and will sniff most things unless it's a mop – in which case she will hide behind you because she is scared of mops!


She loves following you around the house, but is not anxious to be by herself at home and responds very calmly to being in the crate. When we are outside, Nova makes sure that everyone is included, rushing home whenever someone is left behind! If she does not see you, she may also check every single car in the garage to make sure that you are not in there :)

name: Dom
description_html:
Dom is a fun, playful, and incredibly handsome boy who’s ready to find his forever home. He’s easy to harness, and once you toss a toy out of his kennel, he’s all in and ready to go! Dom can be strong at first on leash, but after he gets some energy out, he settles in nicely and relaxes.

Dom is very smart and listens well—he already knows tricks and is eager to learn more, especially when food and treats are involved (they’re his favorite!). He absolutely loves spending time playing in the yard, showing off his playful and goofy side.

With a medium energy level, Dom would be a great match for an active lifestyle, and he’ll likely relax even more once he’s out of the shelter environment. He’s leash trained, house trained, and full of personality—lovable, intelligent, and always ready for fun.

name: Chewbaca
description_html:
Chewbaca had quickly earned his spot as a dog volunteers love to take out. He has excellent leash manners, he matches your pace and follows your lead with ease. In the play yard he has some adorably sporadic zoomies and is always up for fetch.

He likes to meet new people gently, and once you’re friends he’s all about the cuddles. This sweet boy is house trained, calm, and oh so loving. He’s newer to the shelter so we’re still getting to know this easy going sweetheart. Between his pleasant demeanor and his unique looks we don’t anticipate him being with us long.

name: Henrietta
description_html:
Henrietta is one of the most playful, joyful pups you’ll ever meet. She loves a good snuggle on the couch or bed, and loves to chase tennis balls outside.


During her two months in foster care, she was housetrained, crate trained, polite to the many people she met (including kids!), and an excellent patio pup. She loves other dogs, especially if they can match her rowdy play style.

name: Apple Fritter
description_html:
Apple Fritter is the perfect mix of sweetness and smarts! This loving, cuddly boy adores being close to his people - whether it’s snuggling on the couch or leaning in for a hug. He’s a great listener and eager to please, making him a joy to have around.


Apple Fritter is both crate trained and house trained, so he’s already mastered his manners and is ready to fit right into your home. He loves attention but also knows how to relax quietly when it’s time to wind down.


If you’re looking for a loyal companion who will shower you with affection and make every day brighter, Apple Fritter is your guy!

name: Hendrix
description_html:
Hendrix is a two-year-old heartthrob with one goal in life: to love his person with his entire soul. He’s fully house-trained, incredibly smart, and very treat-motivated (which means training with him is basically just a snack-based friendship).


His favorite “job” at the shelter is visiting the real-life rooms on campus with volunteers, where he takes his snuggling very seriously. Couch? Claimed. Lap? Claimed. Emotional support duties? Nailed it. Hendrix doesn’t just cuddle — he commits.


This boy is affectionate, gentle, and deeply people-oriented. He’s the kind of dog who looks at you like you’re his whole world… because you are. Once Hendrix picks his person, that’s it — you’ve found your soul dog.


If you’re searching for a loyal best friend, a professional snuggler, and a dog who will love you harder than you thought possible, Hendrix is ready and waiting. Email orangedotcrew@gmail.com to learn more and kickstart this heartwarming journey! For more pupdates, follow Orange Dot Crew on Facebook and Instagram.

name: Howie
description_html:
Howie is a sweet German Shepherd who is housetrained, very playful, and easygoing! He's had experience living with another dog at the shelter and going to playgroup, so he could do well with a dog-sibling after a meet & greet to make sure it's a good fit!

Howie sits quickly for treats or toys and loves to show how smart he is. He loves to splash in the kiddie pool, chase balls, and walks great on a leash! He would make a lovely addition to your family.

name: Evermore
description_html:
Evermore is a very good boy who walks well on leash and will "sit" for a treat. He is housetrained and crate trained, as well. Evermore is affectionate with people and enjoys that quality time getting his walks at the shelter.


Evermore is a sweet, calm and gentle boy. He’s also one of the most housetrained dogs at the shelter. He does well meeting new people and he seems comfortable being around other dogs and he could possibly live with a well matched dog.


We would love to see this boy in a home instead of a kennel! Meet Evermore today!

name: Tigger
description_html:
Meet Tigger 💙


Tigger is one of those dogs who makes you smile the moment you meet him. Friendly, calm, and incredibly affectionate, he greets people with a loose, wiggly body, soft eyes, and a happy tail. Within minutes, he’s handing out kisses, leaning in for pets, and soaking up attention like he’s known you forever.


This sweet boy loves toys — especially soft toys and tennis balls — and will proudly bring them over to show off. In playtime rooms, he’s playful and happy, but he also knows how to relax and enjoy cuddles, belly rubs, and butt scratches. Volunteers consistently describe him as incredibly easy, well-mannered, and one of the most house-trained dogs they’ve met in the shelter.


Tigger walks beautifully on leash and is very responsive to direction and cues. He knows how to sit, is treat-motivated, and does well transitioning in and out of his kennel. While he may show mild excitement when he sees other dogs, it’s friendly curiosity — he’s non-reactive passing kennels and even stops to give sweet greetings through the gate, complete with wiggly tails and nose kisses.


He enjoys sniffing around, spending time with people, and would thrive in a home that offers love, routine, and maybe a few good toys to toss around. A house with a yard would be wonderful, but Tigger could also do well in an apartment with regular walks and enrichment.


Tigger is a laid-back cuddler with a playful side — a truly special dog who’s ready to be someone’s best friend.


💫 Good on leash

💫 House-trained

💫 Affectionate & cuddly

💫 Toy-loving

💫 Easy, gentle companion


If you’re looking for a sweet, loving dog who will adore you back tenfold, Tigger might just be your guy. 🐾💙

name: Daisy
description_html: Daisy is an adventurous soul who loves going on walks and exploring her surroundings. She can pull on leash, but she's working on that. Practice makes perfect! Daisy may be a little nervous with initial greetings, but it doesn't take long to see her tail wag and her body relax. She's ready to bust out of here and get on with her new life in a real home!

name: Canela
description_html: Canela has such a wonderful personality and is such a sweet girl. She’s playful and loves fetch with her stuffies (she’s pretty good at dropping them for you to toss too!). She also loves playing in the little puppy pools, and splashing around in them. She’s also very house trained! Once she works out her zoomies, she’s super easy on a leash. She’s a super cuddly young pup, and loves to lean against her human for pets and scratches.

name: Little Girl
description_html: This little girl is approx 1 year old. Full of energy. Trained to use both a wee-wee pad or outdoors. Her hair is soft to the touch and her color is brownish red with white markings. Her paws are speckled.

name: Candy Corn
description_html:
Candy Corn is not your average dog! This handsome boy stands out with his incredibly unique eyes and coat—a striking brindle pattern set against an orange hue, earning him his sweet and tasty name.

He is a delightful companion who brings joy wherever he goes with his infectious smile.. Candy Corn is very housetrained and leash-trained, making him a breeze to live with. As a true Lab, he adores food and treats (which makes further training fun!).

He’s ready for fun with his favorite activity being fetch, which he’ll happily play until you tire out. Candy Corn is a playful, loving, and unique pup ready to shower his forever family with affection!

name: Tinsel
description_html: This little kitten is shy to warm up, but warm up quickly she will. She is extremely playful and fearful of dogs.

name: Dokie
description_html:
Our charmer here is Dokie and he arrived weather worn and will appreciate a cozy place to stay while his body and soul catches up. He's very easy going and quite charming, gentle on a walk and overall an easy going friend to people and to dogs. We feel he'll get along well with most dogs that don't try to bulldoze him over.

Dokie is a great choice for those who want to help a good dog get back to his very best.

His eyes are receiving treatment and he has some other needs to be checked over.

Meet this sweetheart today. He's advocated for by his friends at Classic Canines ATX - Questions? If on site, reach out to staff. If offsite, reach out to his advocates caring@classiccanines.org

name: Peregrine
description_html:
Peregrine came in as a scaredy kitten, but she's grown into a shy but curious girl while she's been here. She enjoys pets and will stretch out and purr and might grab a bite to eat while you're petting her. Peregrine may still need a slow introduction to a new home (like most cats), but we don't think it will take long for her to settle in. Adopt this special girl today!

I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage!

The adoption fee is waived for Peregrine and ALL Cactus Cats/Desperate Housecats!

name: Gorda
description_html:
Gorda is the kind of dog who wins people over without even trying. She’s a joyful, wiggly, affectionate young pup who thinks every person she meets is her new best friend. Volunteers call her a “walking ray of sunshine” — she’s gentle on leash, friendly with other dogs, and always excited to explore the world with her human friends.

This girl is curious, clever, and incredibly treat-motivated, which makes training fun and easy. She loves learning new things, bouncing around with her dog friends, and then flopping over for pets and cuddles. Gorda currently shares a suite with another dog and attends playgroup most mornings, where she consistently shows good doggy manners and a social, easygoing play style.


Because she’s still a young dog, Gorda needs a family who’s ready to embrace a little goofiness and continue helping her learn the ropes. She’s eager to please, responsive, and already has a great foundation — she just needs patient humans who will show her how to be the best girl she can be.


Gorda’s Highlights:

• Dog-friendly and enjoys playgroups

• Gentle leash walker and easy to handle

• Very treat-motivated and highly trainable

• Sweet, snuggly, and people-loving

• Playful puppy energy in a compact, adorable package


If you’re looking for a cheerful, affectionate, fun-loving companion who will brighten your days and always be excited to see you, Gorda might be your perfect match. Come meet her — this sweet girl is so ready for a home of her own. 💛

name: Mojo
description_html:
Meet Mojo — the ultimate cuddle bug with a heart of gold

Mojo’s love languages are absolutely physical touch and quality time. He’ll accept gifts if you insist, but what he truly wants is to be as close to his human as possible. From the moment you meet him, his gentle, affectionate nature shines. This boy is all about closeness, connection, and soaking up every bit of love he can get.


Mojo is a dream on leash, checks in often with his walker, and already knows cues like sit and shake. He’s polite, well-mannered, and radiates “I want to be your best friend” energy. He also keeps his kennel impressively tidy, suggesting he may be house trained. Passing people and dogs? No problem for this calm, steady guy—he simply minds his manners and keeps moving.


If you’re looking for an affectionate, easygoing companion who loves deeply and loyally, Mojo is your match. Come see why everyone falls for this handsome lovebug.

name: T-Bone
description_html:
T-Bone came to the shelter as a very scared kitten. He immediately went into nose-boop training to help him build confidence. While he's made progress at kitten boop camp, he still needs some extra guidance and support in a new home. T-Bone is a shy guy who may choose to run from new people.

T-Bone has joined our Cactus Cat program to get extra guidance from volunteers on being brave and making friends with people! Cactus Cats tend to love other cats, so these guys may do well in a home with a social kitty friend.

I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage!

The adoption fee is waived for T-Bone and ALL Cactus Cats/Desperate Housecats!

name: Mesquite
description_html: Mesquite is a shy baby boy who seems to like the company of other cats. If you go slowly, you can make friends with him, too! The shelter can be a scary place, so we understand that this boy just needs a quiet and calm space to relax. He's an affectionate boy stuck in a scaredy cat body for now! Help Mesquite grow into a confident boy through adoption or foster today!

name: Ash
description_html:
Hi there! I’m Ash, a bundle of joy packed with curiosity and energy.


Every day is a new adventure for me, and I love exploring every nook and cranny of my surroundings. I’m also quite the brainy pup, always eager to learn new tricks and solve puzzles. My friends here say

I’m sweet and always sporting a smile, which makes every day brighter. I dream of a home where I can share all this love and excitement. I'm also house trained!


If you’re looking for a loyal friend to add zest to your life, I’m your guy!

name: Ollie
description_html:
Meet Your New Best Friend! 🐾

This handsome boy is as sweet and loyal as they come! He’s already potty trained and leash trained, making him super easy to walk and hang out with. He loves people and has a calm, affectionate personality — the kind of dog who’s happiest just being by your side.

He’s currently getting neutered and started on heartworm prevention, so he’ll be healthy and ready for his forever home soon.

Right now, he does show some aggression toward other dogs, but we’re hopeful that will improve after his neuter and once he settles into a loving home. He’s very gentle and well-behaved with people, and with a little patience and structure, he’s going to make an amazing companion.

If you’re looking for a loyal, sweet, and easygoing dog to share your days with, this guy is the perfect match. ❤️

name: Gingersnap
description_html:
Hi! I'm Gingersnap.


My days are filled with joy and I love sharing it! I'm young and full of life. I do the cutest play bow with a hippity hop when playing in the yard and I can't help but make everyone laugh with my silly antics. I love other dogs and would be great in a home with another furry sibling. I'm also housetrained! Sometimes I'm a bit shy, but I'm brave enough to try new things every day. Just go slow with me. The world is so big and I need time to acclimate to it. I dream of a home where I can share all my love and laughter. If you're looking for a sweet, playful companion, I'm your girl! Let's make each other's lives brighter!

name: Lopez
description_html:
Lopez might seem shy at first, but he’s a total sweetheart who’s ready to be someone’s best friend. He’s potty trained, very anffectionate and loves being close to his people. If you’re looking for a dog who enjoys gentle companionship and plenty of love, Lopez is your guy.

For walks, just grab a harness and Lopez is a breeze — he’s easy to walk and happy to stroll by your side, making him a great match for both relaxed outings and daily routines.

Lopez would do wonderfully in a home that values cuddles, a sweet shy pup, and a loyal companion. Come meet him —t it won’t take long to see how special he is

name: Ink
description_html: Ink is a happy-go-lucky guy who’s always up for whatever adventure you have in mind - especially if it involves toys! Ink LOVES a toy and will get so excited he will jog around with it happily, plop in your lap to show you, and then jog around with it again. Despite his enthusiasm, Ink is surprisingly easy to handle — volunteers found him simple to harness and eager to head out for fun. Once in the play yard, Ink is in his element: zooming around, chasing toys, and soaking up every moment. Outside the play yard, Ink is also a great jogging buddy in the making and happily kept pace on a short jog with one of his volunteer friends. He knows sit, likes treats, and is a smart boy who will be easy to train and be up for any adventure with his new people!

name: Chiquis
description_html:
