If you’re looking for a dog who can make you laugh every single day, meet Chiquis — a tiny powerhouse with a HUGE zest for life. Volunteers describe her as a “busy lady” who would rather zoom, hop, and play than sit still for a photo. She loves toys, loves movement, and loves turning the play yard into her personal racetrack.


Chiquis has classic puppy-style enthusiasm: she can be a little jumpy when excited, but she responds well to redirection and absolutely thrives when given something fun to do. She’s sweet, playful, and people-oriented, and once she burns off a little energy, her softer side starts peeking through.


Because she’s new to the shelter, we’re still learning all her quirks — but what we know so far is that she’s spirited, silly, and ready for an adopter who appreciates a high-energy, toy-driven companion.


Chiquis would love a home with:

✔ Playtime, toys, and activities

✔ Positive training to help channel her enthusiasm

✔ Someone who appreciates an energetic, goofy pup


If you’re searching for a pocket-sized adventure buddy who brings joy everywhere she goes, come meet Chiquis — she’s ready to run right into her new life.

name: Bobby
description_html:
It’s time to meet Bobby!


If you’re looking for your soul dog, Bobby is your guy. He is soft, sweet, smart, playful, fun, and very, very cute.


Bobby is currently in foster and doing wonderfully. He’s housetrained, listens well, walks calmly on leash (and loves to find a good stick to carry), and is loving all the cozy naps and endless toys. He would love to have a playful dog sibling to run around with and a human lap to sit in (he would prefer the lap is big enough for him so kids 10+ please)!


Bobby came in to the shelter at just 4 months old. He was completely hairless, wounded, and sick. He’s been working on his glow up and now has the softest fur all over. He has spent so much of his young life in a kennel, and just wants his forever person to snuggle up with.


Watch Bobby on KVUE here!


See more of Bobby on Instagram: @erinfostersdogs

name: Yule
description_html:
Fluffy former teen mom and handsome future house panther kitten seek home together... 1 year old Nellie and 6 month old Yule have bonded quickly in their foster home.

Yule is a patient, gentle, playful boy who brought fearful but sweet Nellie out of hiding with his adorable antics. She joins him in daily games of chase, stalk the fly and their joint favorite: foster-mom-wand-acrobatics.

Yule is an expert cuddler and loves to sleep politely at the foot of the bed with his foster mom. Nellie enjoys pets in her own bed (purrs like a champ) and relaxes there with her fluffy feet hanging out. They share a litter-box and have perfect litter-box habits. They also love their cardboard scratchers.

Nellie and Yule are a truly joyful pair!

The adoption fee is waived for Nellie, Yule, and all Desperate Housecats!

name: S'Mores
description_html:
S’Mores may start out a little cautious, but once he feels safe, he becomes an incredibly loving dog. Volunteers say he’s a “huge love bug” in a calm setting — leaning in for affection, relaxing beside his person, and showing a softness that’s easy to fall for. He’s also house-trained (he pees as soon as he reaches the grass!) and walks calmly on leash once he settles into his routine. Because S’Mores is touch-sensitive, he needs a slow, gentle approach when meeting new people. With patience, he opens up beautifully.


S’Mores’ best qualities:

  • Affectionate and snuggly with familiar human friends
  • Walks nicely on leash
  • House-trained
  • Responds well to routine and gentle handling


Best fit:

  • Patient adopter willing to go slow
  • Someone who understands sensitive, thoughtful dogs


S’Mores is a tender-hearted guy who just needs the right person to help him feel safe. Ready to take things slow? Come meet him today!

name: Squilliam Fancyson
description_html:
Squilliam Fancyson is the definition of handsome! He loves to sniff around on walks, is great with other dogs, and enjoys pets.


He loves to play hard to get by walking around as if you aren't there, but once you get his attention he's actually a softie!


Come meet Squilliam Fancyson today!

name: Bruno
description_html:
Bruno is a soft-hearted boy who’s finding shelter life a little overwhelming — and who could blame him? While the noise and bustle can make him anxious at times, volunteers have seen something really special beneath the nerves: a sweet, gentle dog who seeks comfort and connection with his people.


On walks, Bruno is easy to handle and does his best, even when he’s feeling unsure. He’s also very treat-motivated, which helps him build confidence and makes him a great candidate for positive, reward-based training. One especially touching moment came when the shelter grew loud — instead of shutting down, Bruno chose to approach and settle himself between two people, quietly asking for reassurance. It’s clear that once he feels safe, Bruno wants to trust.


Hooray! We're learning all about Bruno's home abilities while he stays with fosters - apply on his link to connect to them.

name: Penny
description_html:
Penny, aka Pretty Penny, was born to love and be loved. She has two modes: Tornado on four legs and couch potato — there is no in between!

This 8-month-old, 45-lb German Shepherd mix is a delightful blend of playful, goofy, and sweetly clingy. She’s clumsy in the most endearing way, loves climbing right into your lap (despite being far too big for it), has zero concept of personal space and will definitely stare at you like you’re her favorite person in the world. Personal space? Never heard of it. Whether she’s doing zoomies across the yard or melting into the couch, Penny’s favorite place is wherever you are.

Penny is very food-motivated — and while her attention span might rival that of a gnat (or a chicken nugget 🍗), she’s smart and eager to please. She’s what we like to call a “pay-me-first” type of employee. She knows sit, look at me, paw, and lay down, but she expects to see the goods (aka treats) before performing her tricks. The good news? She’s starting to respond to commands without a treat in sight — progress, people!

She’s still learning her strength when it comes to jumping up and gentle mouthing during play, so continued guidance will help her polish those puppy manners. She’s house-trained and crate-trained, has never had an accident indoors, and sleeps soundly through the night. She may whine a bit when you leave or head upstairs (she’s just making sure you remember how much she loves you), but she’s improving as she gains confidence and trust.

She’s shown interest in other dogs and has been friendly with neighborhood pups, though she can get a bit too excited during greetings. Penny would thrive in a home where she gets plenty of attention, consistent training, and space to zoom around.

She’s a medium-energy girl who needs time to play, but she’s just as happy to curl up beside you for hours. She does have a jealous streak — after all, she believes she’s the star of the household — and her bark is as big as her personality, so a family who can appreciate her “big voice” will fit her best.

If you’re looking for a loyal, silly, endlessly loving companion who will keep you laughing and your heart full, Pretty Penny might just be your perfect match. 💛

She's currently not a big fan of car rides and can only tolerate about 20-minute drives (she gets car sick) but we're hoping she'll be able to work through that as time goes on.

Adoption requirements:

💛 Room to play (and zoom)

💛 Tolerance for dramatic barking

💛 Love for goofy dogs who give 110% in everything they do

name: Twilight
description_html: Twilight is beautiful - the most photogenic on campus. She is playful, energetic, smart, and ready for an adventurous life.

name: Lady Pablo
description_html:
Meet Lady Pablo

She's been recently paired with a couple of sweet makeover agents, her foster parents, who along with the sponsored care she receives from her friends at ClassicCaninesATX, are restoring her body and spirit. She had been left behind in the washroom of an apartment building, heavily matted into a large fur ball. We don't believe she was ever left outdoors. Someone taught this sweet baby love, they simply did not have the ability to care for her.

She's spayed and heartworm negative. Her weight is perfect. Her matts have been shaved off and for the first time in years she is walking on her real paws, she can feel wind on her skin, her body is capable of full stretches, she can run and fully "feel" again. With that comes time to adjust to her new body and touch, requiring understanding, patience and light management by her VIPs. She loves love and has a spirit that will warm your soul, but can be subject to occasional startles--her body is new to her..

Lady Pablo seems to be very content near cats.

She's had limited engagement with dogs and seems to mostly co-exist, although we think she would prefer to have all of the people attention for herself.

Her ideal person or people will have some experience with small dogs that need a little extra help and guidance in life, It's her turn to catch up for all the years she's lost out on.

Interested in learning more?

Click on her link to reach her foster parents.

name: Goldie
description_html: Gorgeous girl Goldie is a 9 month old Belgian Shepherd thriving in foster! Goldie is a lovely sweet goofball and will grow up to be an elegant, long-legged blonde! If she was a person, she'd be a supermodel! At 9 months old she is about 50 pounds and will likely top out around 60 pounds She can be a little shy meeting new humans, but warms up quickly. She recently attended several busy adoption events full of new people, dogs, sights and sounds and Goldie was a perfect little lady and behaved beautifully. She was great with all the kids who stopped to pet her as well. She is about 99% potty trained and she's a natural at walking on a loose leash! She adores fetch and tug-of-war. She loves to play with other dogs and wears out her two big canine foster brothers running around the yard. She has been around a cat and wanted to play with it. But she's still a puppy and can adapt to living with cats. This sweet little lady would make a stellar family dog and a great active buddy for anyone looking for a pup that is equal parts energetic adventurer and snugglebug! Could she be your dreamgirl???

name: Ginger
description_html:
Ginger is a smart, curious pup. She is super focused on you or cheese or that sound coming from over there.


She'll do zoomies all over the place and is soooo happy to be out. She seems interested in other dogs who passed, wasn't barking or going crazy but just would run up to the fenceline when they were passing to check them out.


She's really fun and full of energy.

name: Falcor
description_html:
Falcor is a big, gorgeous boy who is very friendly and gentle - no stranger danger! He was surrendered to AAC with a urethral obstruction, and made a full recovery from surgery that removed the narrowest part of his urethra. He has easily transitioned to an anti-inflammatory diet to reduce and help prevent bladder inflammation going forward. 

Falcor is agile and playful, and will fetch toy mice. His meows are tiny, and he will gently raise his front paws onto your legs when he wants attention.

Falcor will do best in a household as an only pet or where his access to food is separate from other pets. He would be a GREAT family pet, but beware, you are liable to get lost in his crystal blue eyes!

Visit Falcor on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/falcor_blue?igsh=N3M4dHBjOWN1ejdz

I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage!

The adoption fee is waived for Falcor and all Desperate Housecats!

name: Angel
description_html:
~ Meet Angel

With 11 yrs of wisdom she's demonstrated herself well as a perfect house mate. Her owner went into hospice. See her short video to see how she has coped with life in the kennel. She's a low maintenance lady who has short spurts of activity before settling in to watch the world from a window view. Let's resolve to make her stay in the shelter system a short one. And if you will give her some small but important pleasures, like letting her hide her toys outdoors, even though they are barely hidden, and offering a cozy cushy place to rest, she promises to be your very best and quiet friend. And she'll love your friends and family too, including the kiddos. Angel is family friendly and ready to spend the holiday in a forever home.


All Adopters of dogs 7 yrs and up receive a $150 veterinary care credit, a $100 Chewy eGift card and adoption fees are waived - ready to make a difference? Reach out to caring@classiccanines.org

name: Mama Eden
description_html:
Mama is an affectionate, high energy girl who wants to soak up all life has to offer. Her favorite things are walks, hikes, playing with her foster brother, and snuggling up for long naps. She has the cutest, most expressive eyes that will truly convey all the love she has for her people. 



Extra info: She would do best in a home with an active lifestyle. She requires A LOT of walks and/or play. She’s a big love bug that is still learning her size, so I don’t think a home with small children would be a good fit.

name: Sawyer
description_html:
Sawyer is a magnificent Mastiff with a heart as big as he is! Although Sawyer is a very big boy, he is the definition of a gentle giant. Don't let his size fool you—this boy is an absolute cuddlebug who thrives on affection and loves nothing more than leaning in for some quality snuggle time.

Sawyer has an incredibly playful spirit and is always up for a good time. He loves to chase balls and play with stuffies.  He's also very housetrained and good on a leash. He does need a strong handler as he can pull when he sees something exciting, like a squirrel.  

Ready to add a loyal, loving, and slightly oversized goofball to your family? Sawyer is waiting to fill your home with cuddles and joy!

name: Cuco
description_html:
Meet Cuco! 


Cuco is a lovable “hippo boy” with a big heart and an even bigger personality. He’s very housetrained, walks nicely on leash, and is highly motivated by food and treats — which makes him a wonderful companion and eager to keep building new skills.


This playful, goofy guy already knows some impressive skills like sit, shake, and down, and he’s always eager to show them off if snacks are involved. Cuco was a total champ during a silly Christmas photo shoot, proving he’s not just sweet but also a great sport with a sense of humor.


In his kennel, Cuco shows off a gentle, sweet presence, and outside he’s full of fun-loving energy. He can get a little jumpy when he’s excited, but he’s learning quickly and responds well to guidance (especially when treats are part of the deal!). With his loose-leash walks, affectionate nature, and silly charm, Cuco is ready to bring laughter and love into a lucky home.

name: Meatloaf
description_html: Meatloaf may be all muscle on the outside, but inside he's just waiting for an opportunity for cuddles and play time. He's a goofy guy who loves to go on walks, but still learning those leash skills. (Meatloaf has yet to look in the mirror and realize how thick his own neck is.) He loves treats and will easily sit for them. He immediately becomes a happy boy when he gets to go on a walk and hang out with people. Meatloaf would probably LOVE a yard to hang out in. He's a nature lover. But, he's also an excellent, calm boy when crated. It doesn't take much to please this guy. Meatloaf is ready to go home today!

name: Fudge
description_html: True to his name, Fudge is as sweet as they come! He is a gentle soul who will shower you with love and devotion. Fudge is house‑trained, walks well on leash, and has a heart full of affection to share. He’s mellow by nature, the kind of dog who will happily sit by your side and gaze at you with soulful eyes that seem to look straight into your heart.

name: Blitz
description_html:
Sweet, playful 1-year-old with higher puppy energy. He's smart and knows some tricks already.

Blitz is a lightning-fast runner — true to his name. He may seem dog-reactive in the shelter due to excitement, not aggression.

A meet-and-greet is recommended for homes with resident dogs.

Blitz would thrive with a large fenced yard or multiple daily walks.


Likely to shine after decompression and quiet time in a home

name: Figgy Puddin'
description_html: Figgy Puddin is an absolute charmer! He's easy for walks and loves to get his wiggles out in a play yard. Figgy has a gentle curiosity for other dogs and people that he sees on his outings. Once play time is over, he's happy to just hang out and watch the world while getting cuddles from his friends. This affectionate and easy going guy is the perfect catch!

name: Quin
description_html:
Quin is a gentle, shy, incredibly sweet dog who has been through far more than most pups should — and yet he remains soft, playful, and eager to connect with people. Volunteers describe him as easy to leash, easy to walk, and a joy to spend time with. He enjoys treats, learns quickly, and loves relaxing on the couch or exploring outside.


Before coming to the shelter, Quin lived peacefully with his finders’ resident dogs and has shown no dog reactivity while at the shelter. He never fails to greet volunteers with wagging softness and calm manners. Once he feels safe, his personality opens up — he’s playful, affectionate, and loves showing off his tricks.


Quin is treat-motivated and appears to be house-trained. While he starts his walks with enthusiastic pulling, he settles into an easy pace after a while. He can be a little shy at first, especially in noisy areas, and may be sensitive to strangers reaching into his space, so he’ll do best with someone who can let him warm up gently at his own pace.


Quin would thrive with:

✔ A calm, patient home

✔ Adults or older teens who respect his space

✔ A resident dog who enjoys soft, friendly company (meet-and-greets available!)

✔ Positive reinforcement and predictable routines


If you already have a dog, our behavior team can help set up a meet & greet to make sure it’s a great fit.


Quin is a truly good dog who has handled life's highs and lows with remarkable grace. Come meet him — you’ll be amazed by how much sweetness and heart he brings to the moment.

name: Miles
description_html:
Miles is an absolute sweetheart who will melt your heart the moment you meet him. He has puppy-like charm!

On leash, Miles is a dream—he walks with a loose leash and rarely pulls, preferring to take his time and thoughtfully sniff his surroundings.

In the play yard, his playful side shines! Miles loves a good game of fetch and is impressively polite about it. He happily drops the toy right at your feet, and if you don’t notice, he’ll adorably nudge it closer, pick it up, and place it right into your hand. Watching him run around with his bouncy little hops is guaranteed to make you smile.

Indoors, Miles settles beautifully. In a real-life room, he explored a bit before relaxing on the couch with a toy, showing just how well he can switch from playtime to cuddle time.

Miles would make a fantastic companion for someone looking for a sweet, playful pup. He’s truly a precious baby who’s ready to bring joy, laughter, and love into his forever home.

name: Lady
description_html: If you are looking for a sweet, easy going cuddle bug then Lady is your girl! She would love nothing more than to cuddle up on the couch to watch tv and relax with you.

name: K’jay
description_html: K'Jay had to be surrendered due to their owner's health issues. This big boy is a cuddler who loves praise! Tell him what a good boy he is and he will be happy the whole day about it. This friendly boy will gladly sit in your lap or lean in to be closer to you. He is one of the most house trained dogs at the shelter. He is big and beautiful. He is a very good boy, who is making lots of human friends amongst the volunteers. He is being very brave, after losing his home and family. He is like a big polar bear that you just want to hug. He's still working on his leash manners and doesn't always realize his own size or strength but he responds well to gentle coaxing. K'Jay is a young, smart guy who is eager to please and loves learning! He so deserves to be running and playing for hours, as he is a young dog.

name: Bellanova
description_html:
To say that Bellanova doesn’t like other pets is a bit of an understatement. She REALLY doesn’t like them.

Bellanova suffers from anxiety, and does best when on medication (she was previously on gabapentin, and it worked very well for her). Her previous owner loved her dearly, but could no longer take care of her, so they brought her to AAC. We would LOVE to get her into a real home, either through adoption or through foster (she does best with women).

Her owner told us that Bellanova is playful, talkative, independent, and high energy. She will give hard love bites when she’s overstimulated. Due to her anxiety, she is afraid of almost everything, and when she is startled, she is likely to attack. As long as she is on medication, she is well-behaved.

Bellanova must go to a home with no other pets and a very cat-savvy adopter. 

I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage!

The adoption fee is waived for Bellanova and all Desperate Housecats!

name: Rudolph
description_html:
This sweet, floppy-eared pup is as cute as his name suggests. Rudolph is a young, energetic bundle of joy who loves nothing more than playtime and cuddles. Whether he's chasing after a tennis ball or curling up beside you for snuggles, he does everything with a big, happy heart.

Rudolph is a fetch champion in the making and absolutely lights up when he sees a toy. He’s also a dream on walks—no pulling, no zig-zagging—just a gentle little trot from a very good boy who loves exploring the world by your side.

Playful, affectionate, and endlessly cheerful, Rudolph is ready to bring joy to a lucky family. If you’re looking for a sweet companion who’ll keep you smiling and your heart full, come meet this happy fella today!


email blueplusbusters@gmail.com for more info!

name: Poppy
description_html:
Meet Poppy – The Independent Adventurer!


Poppy is a playful, curious little kitten who would thrive in a home with other cats who are tolerant of her energy. She’s a fan of exploring and loves to "hunt" toys, proudly carrying them around like trophies! While she enjoys being around people, she’s a bit of an independent spirit and likes to engage on her own terms.


One of her most charming traits is her love for conversation—she’s a talker, with lots of chirps and trills, and she’ll happily respond when you chat with her. If you're looking for a kitten with a fun, quirky personality who loves both independence and interaction, Poppy could be the perfect fit for you!

name: Daisy
description_html:
Foster Day 1!

• Calm and relaxed in the car; enjoyed the window and laid down comfortably

• Slow but calm exploring the new house; a little timid but not reactive

• Follows me closely and shows strong trust/bond with humans

• Overall temperament: gentle, people-oriented, calm, slightly shy in new environments


Daisy is very human oriented and is fully house trained! She needs a little work walking on the leash, but she loves walks! She is the sweetest girl, all she wants is to lay her head on you and be pet. I believe she is the perfect family dog or for anyone that doesn’t have any current pets in the house! She loves car rides, sniffing around outside, playing with the bone, ball, etc! She also is a very big cuddler, and stays off furniture unless invited on!

name: Gumdrop
description_html:
Got a sweet tooth? Even if you don’t, one look at this sweet boy and you’ll want to scoop him right up.

He may be young and still learning the world outside the shelter, but in a home he’s proven to be an absolute gentleman. He’s house‑trained, crate‑trained, and non‑destructive when left alone. With medium energy, he’s always up for a walk or adventure, but just as happy to curl up at your feet for an afternoon nap.

He’s done well in playgroup and could live with a well‑matched canine buddy.

Email Blueplusbusters@gmail.com to connect with volunteers for more info!

name: Edmond
description_html:
Sweet Edmond has had a rough start to life. He was found living on the streets with two other dogs, doing his best to survive day by day. When his little group was rescued, Edmond was understandably overwhelmed by all the changes. After the female dog he was closest to was taken to the shelter, he completely shut down in his finder’s home — his world had suddenly become a much lonelier place.


Despite his fear, Edmond has a gentle soul. He’s not ready to seek out affection yet, but he watches the world with soft, hopeful eyes — you can tell he wants to trust.

Edmond will need a very patient, understanding foster or adopter who can give him time to feel safe again.


A calm home, possibly another friendly and confident dog, and someone who can offer stability and kindness will help him blossom at his own pace.


If you have the heart to help a scared dog learn that the world can be kind, Edmond is waiting for you.

name: Onyx
description_html:
Meet Onyx! 🖤🐾


Onyx is a sweet, playful boy who loves to cuddle and enjoys spending time with other dogs—especially his bonded buddy, Cheddar. He’s affectionate, social, and happiest when he has toys to play with and a cozy spot to snuggle into.


If you’re looking for a pair of loving companions with gentle hearts and a fun side, Onyx (and Cheddar) could be your perfect match.

name: Cassidy
description_html:
Cassidy is a vibrant one-year-old pup who is ready to bring a burst of energy to your life! With his striking black-and-tan coat and a heart-shaped white patch on his chest, Cassidy is as handsome as he is happy. He is a high-energy, playful companion who thrives on adventure, whether it’s a game of fetch in the yard or a long hike on a sunny trail (he’s great on a leash).

Cassidy is the ultimate "yes" dog—always up for fun and quick to offer a goofy, tongue-out smile. If you’re looking for a loyal, active best friend, Cassidy is your boy!

name: Lil Baby Lou
description_html:
Yes, he’s 95 pounds.


Yes, his name is Lil Baby Lou.

And yes… he is absolutely, unquestionably a baby.


Lou is a dog built like a linebacker but powered entirely by love, snuggles, and the belief that he was meant to be a lap dog. Don’t let the size fool you—this big boy’s favorite activities include cuddling, being near his people, and giving hugs. His heart is as soft as a marshmallow. 


Lil Baby Lou is extremely house trained (a true gentleman), rides like a champ in the car, and is always down for a good toy session. Toss him a toy and you’ll see his playful, goofy side shine—then he’ll happily settle in for some quality couch time. If you’ve ever wanted a giant teddy bear who thinks he’s a baby and has total soul dog potential, Lou is your guy. 


Come meet Lil Baby Lou—he promises to take up space in your home, on your couch, and most importantly, in your heart. Email orangedotcrew@gmail.com to learn more and kickstart this heartwarming journey. For more delightful updates, follow Orange Dot Crew on Facebook and Instagram.

name: Ranger
description_html:
Ranger is a charming Husky-mix with a heart as bright as his snowy coat. Ranger is a soulful, gentle companion; he is a total dream on the leash, maintaining a polite, steady pace that makes every stroll through the neighborhood a relaxing joy.

With his striking amber eyes and attentive, upright ears, Ranger is always tuned in to his human’s needs. Whether you’re heading out for a morning adventure or enjoying a quiet afternoon, his sweet nature makes him the perfect cuddly partner.

name: Nala
description_html:
Hi, I'm Nala!


I love showing off my "sit", "stay" and "come" commands, especially if there is a treat involved! I'm playful and cuddly, always ready for a game or a snuggle. My curiosity makes every day an adventure. I'm also brave and smart, which makes me a quick learner. I enjoy my independence but making friends is my favorite. I've got endless energy for fun and exploration. I'm also house trained and great in the car! Looking for a loyal companion who's up for anything? I'm your girl! Let's start our

adventure together!


  • House trained
  • Playful
  • Great in the car

name: Pickles
description_html: Pickles is mellow for a floppy puppy. He is curious and intelligent, knowing sit and other commands. He looks at you in the eyes and is ready to follow you anywhere, especially if cheese is involved. He has been unlucky in that he's been back in quarantine for a cold for a while, then the pneumovirus outbreak happened. If this sweet boy saw more people, he'd be snatched up.

name: Cillian
description_html: Cillian came into the shelter due to housing restrictions. He's shy, quiet and may prefer to hide when he's feeling insecure. Cillian was a very independent cat in his previous home. He's low-maintenance and there may be times you don't even know he's there! But, Cillian will choose his moments for snuggles and he does enjoy pets. His one weakness might be shoelaces. He loves to chew them, so put your shoes away and get this guy a proper wand toy! He's lived with other cats and dogs so may do well in a multi-pet home.

name: Misty
description_html:
Misty is an absolute sweetheart who steals hearts the moment you meet her. This precious girl is a true cuddle bug who loves to snuggle, walks nicely on leash, and is house trained—basically a dream companion.


She can be a little shy at first, but she warms up quickly and loves playing with toys in the play yard. She can even entertain herself with her favorite toys, making her a lovely mix of gentle and playful.


If you’re looking for a sweet, affectionate pup who will happily curl up by your side, Misty might just be the one.

name: Tyson
description_html:
Meet Tyson


He's been in a finder foster's condo for one month while waiting for his intake appointment. He was an awesome guest. He stayed with a female 50 lb dog and 3, yes THREE, cats! What a good boy.

He's a very nice walking dog and got out for 4-5 potty breaks a day and never marked or had accidents in the home. He even was quite agreeable to bathing.

He knows common cues like sit, stay and come.


His most endearing qualities - he's a big, beautiful, loving baby, inside and out, extremely loyal and obedient - likes to cuddle on a lap like a little dog would. Tyson is advocated for by his friends at caring@classiccanines.org - click his link or write caring@classiccanines.org for help.

name: Leonard
description_html:
Leonard is a sweet, playful boy with a perfect balance of energy and fun. He walks well on leash, knows sit, and is very treat-motivated—especially when the snacks come from his favorite toy, the wobbler!


He loves playtime, can happily entertain himself in the yard, and enjoys being around other dogs. If you’re looking for a medium-energy pup who knows how to have a good time, Leonard could be your guy.

name: Flora
description_html: Flora is the sweetest cuddlebug. She's a long and low, short shiny black coat with white blazes. Her ears are luxurious, her tail is super wags. I found her on the streets a couple months ago, her history is unknown - she's on a grand adventure and looking for her forever people. Her top priorities are snuggles and pillow princess naps, and activities such as supervising squirrels and sticks, and rumpus time with toys or dog friends. Flora loves doing whatever you're doing. She's well-behaved and engaged on walks, plays well with my dog, and learns games and tricks easily. If left to her own devices, she'll make a nest of any available pillows and chill. She's untested with children, but she's a mama, very gentle and sweet with everyone. Flora is housetrained, solid on basic commands, treat motivated and eager to please. She's working on leash reactivity, and responding well to redirection. Flora is so chill, when you give her a loving home she'll be happy with the daily activities of your household. Flora is spayed and chipped, up to date on vaccinations, and takes Symparica Trio monthly. She's in great shape, no known conditions.

name: Crosby
description_html: Crosby is terrified in the shelter. This shy boy was abandoned so we understand his difficulty trusting us so soon in his stay at the shelter. But, we'd really love for him to have a true friend, the one he deserves in a home, and we suspect he will be a loyal companion to whoever offers him their friendship. If not adopted soon, we'd love to see Crosby in foster care where he can relax and come out of his shell gradually. He will do best in a low traffic, quiet spot with someone who can provide consistent, gentle attempts at interaction while also giving him the space he requests to adapt.

name: Vic
description_html:
Vic is a Cactus Cat learning to trust people more! Cactus Cats are shy but usually really love cat companions and do well in homes with other cats. Vic will need a calm place where he can continue his nose-boop training (a confidence building exercise that helps kitties build relationships with people). Luckily this boy loves Churu, so this is an easy reward for his hard work. He enjoys pets, you just have to go slowly and reward his bravery with his favorite treat!

I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage!

The adoption fee is waived for Vic and ALL Cactus Cats/Desperate Housecats!

name: Shadow
description_html: Handsome greyhound Shadow is a happy, friendly dog who walks easily on leash and is very housetrained. He loves to romp around the play yard, running zoomies and chasing balls. Shadow also enjoys playing along the fence line with other social dogs. He responds promptly to basic commands and gently accepts treats. Shadow is a sweet, playful boy who will make a wonderful companion in a loving home. Shadow looks like a show dog. He has a prince-like quality. He’s fancy! Come meet him!

name: Priscilla
description_html:
Priscilla may be a little shy at first, but she warms up quickly—especially if you have treats! Once she’s comfortable, she turns into the snuggliest, cuddliest, kissiest girl you’ve ever met. She’s incredibly gentle, with no mouthing or nipping, just pure sweetness.

When playtime arrives, she loves chasing toys around the yard and zooming happily after anything that bounces. She also walks beautifully on leash and enjoys exploring the world by your side.

Priscilla is ready to find her forever family—one that will give her the love and patience she deserves. Could that be you?

Come meet her and fall in love!

name: Fezziwig
description_html:
Fezziwig is a Cactus Cat learning to trust people more! Cactus Cats are shy but usually really love cat companions and do well in homes with other cats. Fezziwig will need a calm place where he can continue his nose-boop training (a confidence building exercise that helps kitties build relationships with people). He may also do well in a home with a confident cat to show him that people aren't scary. We would love for Fezziwig to continue his journey with a patient adopter willing to give him the space and opportunity he needs to grow.

I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage!

The adoption fee is waived for Fezziwig and ALL Cactus Cats/Desperate Housecats!

name: Hermey
description_html:
Hermey is a Cactus Cat learning to trust people more! Cactus Cats are shy but usually really love cat companions and do well in homes with other cats. Hermey will need a calm place where he can continue his nose-boop training (a confidence building exercise that helps kitties build relationships with people). He may also do well in a home with a confident cat to show him that people aren't scary. We would love for Hermey to continue his journey with a patient adopter willing to give him the space and opportunity he needs to grow.

I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage!

The adoption fee is waived for Hermey and ALL Cactus Cats/ Desperate Housecats!

name: Teddy
description_html: Teddy and Liam came in together and love each other very much, so they should be adopted together. These boys arrived at the shelter when their owner was no longer physically able to care for them. Teddy is a cuddly lap cat who loves to play with toys. He's talkative and has no problem sharing his feelings with you. Liam is quiet, shy and more on the independent side, but he also enjoys play time. Liam is a calm soul who is content to hang out near his people and enjoy their company. These boys have been through a lot of change, so they may take a little time adapting to new situations. Give Teddy and Liam a chance today!

name: Liam
description_html: Teddy and Liam came in together and love each other very much, so they should be adopted together. These boys arrived at the shelter when their owner was no longer physically able to care for them. Teddy is a cuddly lap cat who loves to play with toys. He's talkative and has no problem sharing his feelings with you. Liam is quiet, shy and more on the independent side, but he also enjoys play time. Liam is a calm soul who is content to hang out near his people and enjoy their company. These boys have been through a lot of change, so they may take a little time adapting to new situations. Give Teddy and Liam a chance today!

name: Princess Peach
description_html: Meet Princess Peach! She really wants you because she loves new friends. This girl enjoys walks, play time and cuddling with her friends, and if you give her a toy to carry around it will truly make her day! Princess Peach is housetrained and crate trained. She's ready to take on the world with a toy in her mouth and a friend by her side, so say "hello" to this girl today!

name: Elf
description_html:
Elf is ready to be your sidekick best friend for adventures around Austin. This handsome, 1-year-old brindle pup is a 50-pound bundle of joy and athletic energy.

Elf is the ultimate fun-sized pup. He’s the perfect age—past the puppy stage, but still full of youthful curiosity, playfulness, and treat-motivated for trainability. Whether it’s playing fetch, chasing toys, going for a hike, or investigating the sights and sounds of the neighborhood, Elf is ready to jump in with tail-wagging enthusiasm.

With his striking coat and soulful eyes, Elf is as charming as he is active. He’s looking for an upbeat home that matches his zest for life and love for the outdoors.

name: Bear
description_html:
Meet Bear!


Bear was surrendered to the shelter after losing his home to a fire. He's still pretty new to the shelter but this is what we have discovered so far:


  • House Trained
  • Likes affection from friends
  • Sweetheart
  • Does well on walks
  • Loves to romp around a yard
  • Treat Motivated
  • Happy Boy


Volunteers have described him as:


  • "A new favorite!"
  • "A total blast!"
  • "I can't wait to get some quality time with this guy because I will love him!"


Bear is available for foster or adoption!

name: Holly
description_html:
Hi, my name is Holly, or Holly Doll as my mom likes to call me. I guess she always tells me that I am such a doll…whatever that means. I want to start off by saying that I am really, really laid back. I think they call me a lap dog, which I laugh at, because I really am too big for your lap, but I enjoy snuggling up all close to you and laying in your lap and giving you tons of affection. I do love playing with my big Boxer sister, but I look forward to my downtime where I can stretch my body out and just relax. I will get along with any dog really, as I am mild mannered and incredibly respectful of their space, food, toys and treats.

I do love a good squeaky toy every now and then, too. I enjoy my walks and I am very, very good on a leash. I get so excited when I see people or other dogs when I am out, but I cannot help it, I enjoy the attention and want to play!!  I am working on controlling my excitement though – which is no fun. I appear to be good with kids, although I don’t currently live with any, but my mom can tell how happy I get when we see kids out and about. I wag my tail really fast and tap my feet and try to pull her near them. I don’t know if I am good with cats either. I do not currently live with any and we haven’t come across any on my walks. I can keep you posted though.

I am crate, leash, house and potty trained. I learn very quickly and I love the one-on-one time I get with my mom when she is teaching me.  I am not a big barker, although my Boxer sister sometimes tries to get me to join in with her, but I can resist. I like riding in cars and will jump right in to go anywhere.

Overall, I am a wonderful pup. I can have little bursts of puppy energy, but for most of the day, I am laid back. I am super friendly and sweet.

name: Winston
description_html:
⭐ Meet Winston — your built-in best mood booster!

Winston is an easygoing, happy boy with a goofy, fun-loving spirit that will keep you smiling. At just 39 pounds, he’s perfectly pint-sized—full of energy without feeling overwhelming. He’s energetic and ready to go, making him a great match for an active home or a running buddy. Winston also enjoys fetch, knows his sit and down commands, and loves soaking up pets and affection between bursts of play.

He’s easy to handle, cooperative, and eager to engage with his person. With his adorable face, bright personality, and joyful energy, Winston is the kind of dog who turns everyday moments into fun adventures. 🐾

name: Chip
description_html: Meet Chip! Chip is a curious yet gentle bunny who enjoys exploring and spending time around people on his own terms. He likes to approach for attention and investigation, then retreat to his pen when he's ready to relax. Chip communicates clearly when he needs space, so he'd do best with someone who understands and respects bunny boundaries. He loves head and back rubs, but prefers not to have his feet or belly touched and does not enjoy being picked up. Carrots are his favorite treat, while bananas are a definite no! Chip can be sensitive to loud noises, so a calm home without very young children or dogs would suit him best. With the right introduction, he may also be a good candidate for bonding with another rabbit. Overall, Chip is a sweet, thoughtful bunny who will thrive in a patient, loving home that lets him blossom at his own pace. 🐰💛

name: Buttercup
description_html:
This gentle, affectionate pittie came to us thanks to a kind Good Samaritan after she was found abandoned with her five puppies. Even on her first day, Buttercup showed us who she is at heart: calm, trusting, and endlessly loving. She allowed strangers to carry her and handle her puppies without a hint of worry — a true testament to her gentle nature.


Her pups, already old enough to be weaned, returned to their finder and are quickly finding homes. Buttercup, however, stayed with us so we could care for an injury to her left front leg that left her a bit lame. X-rays showed no fractures, and with rest, medication, and TLC, she has made a remarkable recovery.


Now Buttercup is ready to take the next step: a foster or adoptive home of her very own.

She has quickly become a staff and volunteer favorite — the kind of dog people go out of their way to visit because she brightens everyone’s day. We would love nothing more than to see her curled up on a soft bed in a real home instead of a kennel.


If you're looking for a gentle, loving companion who will melt your heart, Buttercup is your girl. Come meet her and see why we all adore her.

name: Biscuit
description_html:
Biscuit is a sweet, affectionate puppy who gets very excited to be loved on. He’s still young and full of classic puppy energy, but he’s already surprisingly good on leash and can walk nicely with a licki mat or treats for support. Biscuit can be a little jumpy (as puppies are!) and is sensitive to loud barking, especially in dark or busy environments, but he shows clear signs of curiosity and playfulness around other dogs rather than fear.

With consistent exercise, enrichment, and positive-reinforcement training, Biscuit is going to grow into a fantastic companion. He’ll thrive with adopters or fosters who understand that puppies take time, patience, and daily mental and physical outlets—but the payoff will be huge.

Sweet, eager, and ready to learn, Biscuit is a baby with big potential just waiting to be unlocked.

name: Charlie Brown
description_html:
Introducing Charlie Brown, a sweet Gentle Giant!


Charlie Brown is a mellow, quiet and affectionate big boy who strolls along easily on leash and likes to stay close to his person. He is housetrained and has a calm demeanor while passing barking dogs in the kennels. In the playyard, Charlie Brown enjoys checking out the surroundings and running a few loops, then he returns for attention and cuddles with his companion.


Charlie Brown is a special young dog waiting to become a cherished member of a loving family. Come meet him!

name: Shady
description_html:
Meet Shady 💕

This little pup has had a rough start but is blossoming into the sweetest companion. Shady is curious, affectionate, and eager to learn what it means to be part of a forever family. She’s doing great in foster care and is ready to bring love, laughter, and lots of tail wags into her new home. This sweet girl does wonderful with other dogs, and loves children of all ages!

name: Elara
description_html: Elara is a sweet, shy girl who likes dog friends. They help with her confidence.

name: Rico
description_html: Rico is a calm, sweet, and laid-back pup who is easy to get in and out of his kennel. He walks nicely on a loose leash and loves taking his time to sniff along the way. Rico is also a fun-loving happy pup who is cuddly and will chase toys around in the yard. Rico is a smart boy who knows sit, shake, and down, is house trained, and absolutely loves food and treats. This gentle boy would make a wonderful, easygoing companion.

name: Minnie
description_html:
Sweet, adorable Minnie stares deep into your eyes probably more than any other little cat you know, making you feel like you’re the absolute best. 


Minnie loves to begin her day with a play sesh featuring the best-ever fishing pole wand toy, where she might convince even you that the feathers on the end of it are actually a bird! Her mouser skills are incredible — Minnie hunkers down, pupils wide, tracking every twitch of the feathers until just the right moment to SPRINT into action. On carpet or a rug, she has impressive speed and agility! And when that “bird” takes flight, Minnie transforms into a (still overwhelmingly adorable) fierce aerial hunter, launching into the air with entertaining acrobatics to pluck her prey out of the sky. Her second favorite game to play involves a donut shaped tunnel with two entry points. She will dash into it, and if you tease the outside of the tunnel with a stick or fabric covered wire (in our case), she goes absolutely berserk attacking it from within— make absolutely sure you don’t touch the tunnel with any part of your body because she is in the ZONE!! You’ll be so entertained as she uses her claws to pull herself around the tunnel on her back! She’s such a funny little playmate!


Minnie came to us off the street, but she clearly was raised by humans, as she wants to spend as much time with them as possible. She is very vocal, and loves to talk to you. She has all sorts of thoughts about everything! If only we could understand what those thoughts are… If you work from home, Minnie is going to be your reliable coworker, always there to give you a little hit of dopamine or oxytocin throughout your day. As you stare into your monitor, Minnie will curl up in your lap, especially if you have a blanket there. When she’s not napping, she will explore your desk, passing by to rub her face on your chin. Her loves are a fantastic pick-me-up throughout the day!


Minnie gets along great with other cats, especially if given a metered introduction. She would love to have a friendly playmate!


If you’re looking for a lovey, playful companion, Minnie is your little gal!! Come meet her and let her steal your heart!!

name: Persephone
description_html: This is a feral momma kitty who I have been working on taming in foster with her babies. She's still likely to hiss if approached too quickly and be tightened up as hard as a rock when you touch her, but with some dedication I have gotten her to start relaxing during pets and even put her chin up and press into some neck and chin scritches. Definitely can't pick her up with your hands, but placing a blanket or towel over her makes her limp enough to handle and transport her. I believe she can be domesticated and put into a good home, but it will take continued work. Named Persephone because I got two kittens from her the year before these four kittens, so she was like Persephone coming back from the underworld every year bringing me new pretty babies. She has now been spayed to end that cycle!

name: Meatball
description_html:
This gorgeous girl may need some help getting to a healthier weight, but she doesn’t need any help stealing your heart! Meatball came to the shelter when her previous owners were not able to care for her anymore. She’s been slowly losing weight in her foster home, and has started to be more active and playful.

She’s a big fan of wand toys and ball toys, but her favorite activity is watching TV with you on the couch. Meatball loves being around people, and will often choose to be in the same room as you. She is the cuddliest lap kitty ever, and likes to sleep in your bed at night. She is rather chatty too, and will share her opinion with you.

Meatball can be a little skittish, so she should go to a quiet home where she can decompress and get comfortable. Her new family should also continue to support her weight loss journey. With her cute markings and snuggly personality, Meatball will make you fall in love in no time!

I am a DHC, and I have my own webpage!

The adoption fee is waived for Meatball and ALL Desperate Housecats!

name: Sweet Pea
description_html: Sweet Pea is a fun little guy! Loves to play and play battle and run around with the other kittens. He can be a siren sometimes, squealing his cute little head off, but then he calms down and melts. He's the only of his siblings that is sleek rather than a puff ball. A very handsome gentleman!

name: Florence
description_html: Florence doesn't appreciate being stuck in a kennel all day. Kennel life isn't easy on most cats, especially active ladies like Florence. She has many sides; she can be silly and affectionate, and she can also be bossy and ready to share all of her opinions. Florence may do best in a cat-savvy home where she is the only cat. Her bossy nature makes her a good fit for a home in need of a cat-manager; someone to handle the treat inventory, oversee the bird watching, regulate play sessions and make sure her humans are reaching their best potential. Help Florence get a permanent break from the shelter today!

name: Daisy
description_html:
~ Meet Daisy


Daisy arrived with a 30lb dog named Zoe (19500) and try as we did, we could not find a home to take both together. Thankfully they seemed to be independent spirits, so two volunteers each took one dog home and they are now loving their new foster homes with companionship from the people and their resident dogs.


Daisy is the sweetest land seal you could ever meet. She fit right into a single story home with a cattle dog (with a strong personality), and an aloof shepherd mix. She likes being near her people, and her dog friends. Working in the kitchen? She would love to park and observe if that's ok. Something have your dogs in a ker fluffer? Daisy's going to take the high road and steer away, she does not like conflict. She never been known to bark. Her sweet affectionate and gentle nature will make her a wonderful fit in many homes, with a range of human and animal friends of all ages. Her advocates at Classic Canines are getting Daisy a comprehensive exam and she's already working on her "New Year, New You" weight goals.

name: Zoe
description_html:
~ A fresh start in life


Zoe 19500 and Daisey 19501 arrived together and we knew very little except they lived together indoors. They were checked over, vaccinated and observed, and we found they were very independent of each other. Each went to a different volunteer home and have been doing great with the family pets.


Zoe is a sweet medium size lady of about 32 lbs. She adores human affections and having the resident dog siblings to hang out with. She is mannered and fully house trained.


Her advocates at ClassicCaninesATX have taken care to provide a comprehensive exam and she's very healthy.


Zoe makes a wonderful human and dog companion. Reach out on her link to start a conversation.

name: Hot Dog
description_html:
Meet Hot Dog

He earned his namesake after being found hiding, trying not to be noticed, near a home that was vacated due to a fire. Since being brought in as a foster, he's taken nicely with everyone in the household including a lady dog, two lady cats and two humans. Hot Dog loves to quietly shadow his people through the house. He also loves cuddles. His energy level is low to medium with the occasional daily burst of energy to play fetch or squish a tennis ball for instance. He rides well in the car. He's refining all his indoor skills beautifully - we don't know how long he lived outdoors. If you would like to meet up, please apply on his link - there's no commitment and a trip to the shelter is not required unless you would like to have a doggie meet up which will be scheduled there after meeting Hot Dog in person.

name: Sensei
description_html: Sensei is a baby boy who had a rough start prior to arriving at the shelter. He was rescued covered in mud in a ditch, but luckily other than the mud this guy didn't have any injuries. Since then he's had to get used to us attempting to pamper him. Luckily Sensei LOVES Churu so this is a great way to make friends with him! He would do well in a calm home that can give him slow, steady, positive interactions and reward all of his brave moments. We can tell he has lots of love to give once he trusts you.

name: Ned
description_html:
Ned is a sweet, playful puppy full of fun energy and curiosity. He loves toys, walks nicely on leash, and is highly motivated by treats—making training a great outlet for his enthusiasm.


Like many puppies, Ned can be a little jumpy, but he’s eager to learn and ready for a family who can help him grow into a wonderful adult dog. If you’re looking for a happy, toy-loving companion, Ned might be your guy!

name: Aspen
description_html: Aspen is a cutie! This sweet young pup has typical Husky characteristics and greets you with excited yips when it’s time for an exercise break. Aspen walks nicely on leash and enjoys zoomies in the playyard and entertaining herself with toys. She appears dog friendly and is affectionate with her people. Aspen would thrive in a loving home with ample exercise and patient training to grow into her best self.

name: Sandy
description_html: Sandy is a dream puppy with the perfect puppy energy, fun and joyful. She's affectionate and playful, and will sit for cheese and pets. Sandy is a sweetheart. Come meet her!

name: Jack
description_html: Jack is a low-energy lap cat with so much love to give! He came to the shelter when his owner could no longer care for him, but they had the best things to say about this cuddly boy. His favorite hobby is simply spending his time with his people. Jack has done well living in a home with other cats and seems to enjoy their company. This guy just wants companionship in a big way and we'd love to see him in a home ASAP!

name: Amber
description_html:
She's new and a little nervous because she's a quiet lady and all of her neighbors are very noisy. Amber never jumps into the barking chorus line, preferring to stay quiet. A volunteer took her home to try out and had these things to say ~ She got in/out of car on her own, laid down, and relaxed for the trip. Once at home a little reassurance was the key to opening trust and love. She became playful and seeking of belly rubs and wanted to lay near her person. She proved herself to be housetrained and an expert navigating stairs, and a seeker of the sun and playing ball, and a fan of walks. She was well behaved near other dogs.


Looking for an gentle easy going friend? Put Amber on your must meet list.

A meet and greet with a resident dog can be scheduled after meeting Amber.

name: Josie Rosie
description_html: Meet Josie Rosie, an active tripod girl who would love to be a part of your family!

name: Gemma
description_html:
Gemma is a super affectionate girl around 2 years old (possibly younger based on her teeth). She’s likely an American Bully or Staffy mix and weighs about 62 lbs.

Gemma’s favorite thing in the world is being close to her people. She’s a total cuddle bug who loves leaning on you, touching you, and sleeping right on top of you like a weighted blanket. She has a goofy, funny personality and is incredibly sweet with people.

She has low-to-medium energy and is happy with a mix of playtime (fetch, tug, chew toys) and lots of naps. She can do well in an apartment as long as she gets daily walks.

Gemma is very strong and currently a big puller on leash, especially when she sees other dogs, so continued leash training will be important. That said, she has shown no aggression on walks and rarely barks. She takes treats gently and is food-motivated, which should make training easier.

At home, Gemma is a dream. She’s fully potty trained with no accidents, sleeps through the night, and is not destructive. She currently lives with two adults and has done great. Her compatibility with other dogs, cats, and kids is still being evaluated; due to her size and excitement level, she’d do best with children 10+. Slow, thoughtful introductions to other dogs are recommended.

If you’re looking for a cuddly, loyal companion with a big heart and a great sense of humor, Gemma might be your perfect match.

See more of her at @keep.austin.furry 💛

Meet your new partner in crime 

Bursting with confidence and curiosity, he’s the kitten who charges into every room like he owns the place—and honestly, he kind of does.

He’s playful, fearless, and endlessly entertaining, with a special talent for turning everyday objects into toys and every moment into an adventure. Wand toys, wrestling matches, surprise pounces? Yes please. Nap time? Only after he’s thoroughly conquered the world.

One of his coolest traits: he loves dogs. Big dogs, little dogs—if they’re friendly, he’s ready to be their tiny, whiskered sidekick. He’d thrive in a home with a playful pup or another energetic pet who can keep up with his enthusiasm.

When he finally slows down, he’s sweet, affectionate, and very proud of himself for a day well spent being adorable and chaotic.

If you’re looking for a bold, fun-loving kitten with a big personality and a dog-friendly heart, this little firecracker might just be your perfect match. 💙

name: Horace
description_html:
Horace prefers to take it slowly with new relationships. He would like to get to know you before he commits, and that's purrfectly fine! Horace is a friendly guy once he knows he can trust someone, and he especially loves cats. He may do best in a home with social cats as friends and guides to help him adapt to a new place. This handsome boy has joined our Cactus Cats program to get specialized attention from volunteers on confidence building and meeting new people.


The fee is waived for Horace and all Cactus Cats.

name: Lily
description_html: Lily is a sweet and friendly girl that loves being around people. When I’m laying down she likes to lay on my chest and when I’m working she will occasionally put her feet on my shoulder as if she wants a hug. In fact, when I need a hug I just pick her up to get one and she’s perfectly fine with it. Definitely not anything I can do with my cats.  She’s been a very easy cat to take care of and especially to take to the vet. On the way to and from the vet she never meows or complains which makes vet visits a lot less stressful for both of us. She’s done really well with my cats and seems to enjoys being around them. She would do best with someone who has other cats or works from home.

name: Nanner
description_html:
Nanner is a sweetheart! This handsome big boy is quiet in his kennel, easy to leash and walk, and appears housetrained. He enjoys exploring the playyard and is friendly with other dogs along the fence line.


Nanner is gentle, mellow, affectionate and cuddly. He will make a wonderful companion in a loving home.

name: Milo
description_html:
Milo is the definition of a gentle giant. This sweet, stoic boy is a little shy at first, but once you’ve gained his trust, he loves so deeply. Milo was surrendered to the shelter because his family had to leave the country, but he is flourishing in a foster home now and is ready to find his forever people! 

Milo is a mellow, easy pup. He is perfectly housetrained and naps most of the day with the occasional request for some scritches. Milo is the perfect gentleman on walks - super easy on a leash and passes all manner of exciting things (other dogs, squirrels, cats, people) calmly. He is a quiet boy (zero barking) and takes treats gently from your hand like a dainty prince.

Milo loves sniffs and exploring outside; he would do great in a house with a secure yard or an apartment where he gets some good walks. Milo could fit in with most any lifestyle - he’s laid back so doesn’t need a ton of exercise/stimulation, but could also be a great running buddy. Milo would be the perfect family dog - he has experience living with another dog in his foster home and before the shelter lived with an older child and a cat!

And did we mention his ears?! They are magical and definitely deserve some kind of award.

Click “Get Started” on the right to be connected to Milo’s foster and meet this gentle, soulful boy!

name: Reina
description_html: Reina is an adorable, small, wiggly girl. She is shy at first but warms up quickly into a goofy, cuddly goober. She loves rolling in the grass, getting belly and booty rubs, and snuggling in your lap.

name: Cheyenne
description_html:
Meet Cheyenne -


This lovely and gently spirited lady is just getting her grounding in a foster home and what great home manners she has. She's as sweet as they come and loves affections. She made fast friends with the senior male dog too. She likes to play when he'll oblige, and is respectful when he doesn't.. Outside she wishes she could run like the wind but her left front leg is holding her back. It's not functioning as it should and it appears to be a longstanding issue. Reviews by 2 DVMs at the shelter indicate amputation may be in order. Classic Canines is sponsoring an assessment and surgery as needed, while she's in a foster home, able to recover nicely away from the shelter. Cheyenne's very fit and is expected to regain full mobility.

See her video to see her current state.

We're looking for her forever home where she'll get to run in the wind, go for walks and have all the fun she's missed out on while her leg has held her back. If you like the idea of being part of a new awakening, a new life, Cheyenne is ready to be your life partner too - reach out to

caring@classiccanines.org.

name: Crystal Ball
description_html: Mystic & Crystal Ball came in together when their caregiver had to move away and could no longer take care of them. They are shy and may do best in a low-traffic home without small children. They love to cuddle up with each other and would do well in a home together!

name: Mystic
description_html: Mystic & Crystal Ball came in together when their caregiver had to move away and could no longer take care of them. They are shy and may do best in a low-traffic home without small children. They love to cuddle up with each other and would do well in a home together!

name: Dawg
description_html: Dawg is a playful, bouncy goofball. He wants to please and will sit for treats. He's energetic and will need a lot of attention, whether it's play tile in the backyard or exploring on walks and land.

name: Rooney
description_html: Sweet, curious young fella, who loves pets and scratches. He’s a total cuddle bug, who is also playful.

name: Gordon
description_html: What a handsome big boy! That’s the reaction when you first see Gordon quietly lounging on a blanket in his kennel. This sweet young fellow is a friendly, happy dog who loves to romp around the playyard and check out the surroundings. Gordon is housetrained and walks well with a harness after initial excitement for his exercise break. He shows curious interest in other dogs and is affectionate with his friends. Gordon is a wonderful dog who will make a great companion to the lucky person who welcomes him into their forever home.

name: Kylo Ren
description_html:
This sweet boy arrived with another male dog, an Alaskan Malamute, that was quickly adopted. We learned directly from his people that he also has cat and kid experience. He's gentle on a leash and loves an opportunity to run in the wind when allowed. He's so very friendly. You'll be charmed for sure!


We invite you to come by and meet him. He's advocated for by his friends at ClassicCaninesATX.

name: Sage
description_html: Sage came in with several other cats and seems to really enjoy the company of feline friends. She's joined our Cactus Cat program for shy/timid kitties to help her build confidence with her human friends. Sage is good at "nose boops" for Churu, so this is a great first step in meeting her. She would do best in a low traffic home with a social, friendly cat to show her the ropes! This mild mannered girl is available for adoption today.

name: Pebble
description_html:
Pebble is still learning that this place isn't that scary and we are actually nice people! He loves Churu so that's a good way to start making friends with him. He may do well with a social, friendly cat in the home to guide him on how to be a brave kitty. Pebble is working on his "nose boop" training and will give a boop for a Churu reward. He is going to benefit from slow, consistent interactions with a very patient and cat savvy adopter, and will most likely do best in a low traffic home.


Pebble has joined our Cactus Cats (shy kitty program) to help him boost confidence and trust people.

Brutus is a gentle giant. He lounges around most of the day with 3 cats and a bunny. The cats often take over his bed and he allows it. He loves to go on walks and take in all the smells. He is very curious about other dogs but enjoys his space.

A few things to note, he is terrified of thunder, fireworks and any other loud noises. Walks on trash day aren't his favorite and he refuses to go outside if fireworks are being set off... even from quite a distance.

He has so much love to offer and is the perfect mellow couch potato. Crate trained but free roams and is non destructive.

name: Sylvester
description_html: Sylvester deserves the world! He was trapped in a dog park by a Community Cats Program volunteer after multiple reports of dogs chasing him. He's blossomed into an incredibly affectionate boy here. He doesn't have much confidence yet, but he's working on building trust with humans. All he needs is a couple minutes of you sweet-talking him and he'll be leaning into your pets and rolling over to enjoy his massage. He just needs a chance to show you how wonderful he is.

name: Coco Melon
description_html:
Coco Melon had to be surrendered due to allergies. While she may be shy with strangers, once she gets to know you she's super friendly and loving. She loves playing with squeaky toys and this smart girl knows Spanish commands for "sit" and "paw"! Coco Melon is a special girl looking to be the center of attention in her new home.


Coco Melon is the cuddliest girl!

name: Meowser
description_html: Meowser is a chatty, affectionate boy who loves pets. He came in as a community cat who was an excellent mouser on his property. Now, he's ready to put his hunting skills to work in a home, perhaps with toys and the occasional bug. Meowser is available for adoption today!

name: Diva
description_html: Diva is just that - a big purrsonality in a tiny package! She is still learning that people don't have to be scary, so she needs a slow, steady hand to guide her. Diva will do best in a low-traffic, cat-savvy home without small children. She is getting some training through "nose boops" and this can and should be continued in her new home. (It's easy and we can show you how!) Patience is a must with this little one, but the rewards can be huge! Diva may appreciate a social cat friend to show her how to trust people and relax in a home.

name: Bandit
description_html: We're still getting to know this sweetie who arrived after some sort of house fire. While we work to learn more, he is available for foster and adoption meetups. Check in at the front desk as to his location or if you are offsite, reach out to his advocates at caring@classiccanines.org in case we may have any further information.

name: Cassini
description_html:
Cassini is a sweet and smart girl! As cute as can be, she is gentle and allows all kinds of handling (bath, wiping paws, picking her up when needed). The vet at the shelter said she was the easiest patient they’ve seen.


She is very food/treat motivated and learns commands easily. “Sit” and “crate” are 100%, and we’re working on “down,” “stay” and “come.” In spite of her puppy energy, she can also be very chill and loves to snuggle. She readily goes in her crate and settles.


We have a very old dog and she is respectful of him. She is a little too interested in our cats, but I think she could coexist with cats with some training. Seems more playful than agressive. She’s met a 7-year-old human child and was an angel with her.


Potty training is in process - she has never gone in her crate, even overnight, and goes potty outside easily when prompted. She just hasn’t yet figured out how to signal that she needs to go out, so we make sure to take her out in the yard consistently.


She is good on a leash and has been enjoying regular neighborhood walks.


She’s a real gem of a pup and with training will be an amazing family dog!

name: Norah
description_html: Norah is a nervous nelly in the shelter, but we imagine she will do great in a home setting that is calmer. The shelter is full of loud noises and strange smells, so it’s easy to get startled. Norah enjoys pets and seems to relax when we soft talk her so we think she will be a very affectionate companion cat to a lucky person willing to give her the ultimate break from shelter life!

name: Carmelita
description_html: So far so good! She is a super sweet, affectionate girl! Not a mean bone in her body, loves everyone. Walks on a leash and is fully crate trained. Goes right in her crate and doesn’t bark or anything.

name: Macie
description_html:
Macie is the definition of good-natured. She’s still got that puppy sparkle in her soul — playful, bouncy, and full of joy — but everything she does comes with sweetness and love.


She’s currently in foster care working on her manners (like leash pulling), and she’s learning fast! With a little consistency and a lot of praise, this girl is going to shine.


🐕 Dog-friendly? Yes! She can be a bit pushy… but in a very “hi let’s be BEST FRIENDS RIGHT NOW” puppy way.

🐈 Cat-friendly? Also yes! She adores cats and just wants to play — zero mean bone in her body.

🎾 Favorite games? Fetch is LIFE. Tug-of-war is a close second.

🚗 Car rides? She’s great in the car and ready for adventures.

👩‍🦰👨‍🦱 People? Obsessed. Macie loves every human she meets like she’s known them forever.


Fully house trained and crate trained.


Macie is young, happy, affectionate, and overflowing with love. She’s the kind of dog that makes your house feel warmer and your days a little brighter.


Honestly… what more could you ask for? 💕


📩 If you’re ready for a playful, loving companion who will adore you endlessly, Macie is waiting.

name: Violet
description_html:
Violet is a senior kitty who has had a rough start to 2026. She was brought to AAC with her sister after their owner passed away. She is FIV+, but as long as she gets along with her cat siblings, it's fine (FIV can't be transmitted through grooming or sharing food, only deep bites).

Violet prefers to be near you rather than in your lap, whether you're cooking in the kitchen or watching tv on the couch, she's always a few feet away and will start purring when you're nearby. She is very calm and prefers to sleep most of the time, but she does want daily pets and brushing, and she is easy to pick up. When you leave for work in the morning, you will find her sitting in the same comfy spot on the couch as when you left, making her a great companion for those who aren't home for most of the day. If this easy-going senior gal sounds like a fit for you, take the first steps to meet her today!

name: Holt
description_html:
Meet Holt


He's very unique - a Belgian Shepherd Laekenois mix.

What's more important is that he's smart, both fun and funny, and a great guy to have around. We love watching his every expression, they are a sign of a clever, smart dog who knows a thing or two about good living. He walks nice on a leash with a little spirit in his step and he also goes to doggy play groups! He appears to have been kept indoors and is heartworm negative and neutered and he's ready to go to a new loving living situation right away.


He's advocated for by his fans and friends at ClassicCaninesATX - reach out with questions caring@classiccanines.org or hurry in to meet him onsite!

name: Daisy
description_html: Daisy is a sweet and submissive senior female chihuahua possibly mixed with a Rat Terrier. She has had some downsides with having to move homes due to no fault of her own. This leads to taking some time and love to adjust into her forever home again. She would do best in a calm home with someone who works from home or is retired. She is good with well behaved children but does best with adults. She is looking for a loyal owner who understands and knows how to be patient and empathetic towards animals especially while she builds trust that this will be her forever.

name: George
description_html: George is an affectionate, cuddly boy who loves pets! He came in with a bite injury to his hip, but he was an excellent patient throughout all of his treatment and he has now healed. This friendly boy is done getting into trouble outside. He would much prefer a soft, warm bed with people to pamper him. Adopt George today!

name: Chili Pepper
description_html: Chili Pepper has a lot of feelings about the shelter, and they are all very mixed! Sometimes she likes us, sometimes she doesn’t. Sometimes she wants pets, sometimes she wants us to go away. The shelter can have this effect on smart, sassy girls like Chili Pepper. We think what she really needs is a home to relax in away from the stress of the shelter and other cats. She enjoys pets in moderation here, but she would probably be a super affectionate girl in a calm home setting. She’s just telling us she deserves better than a kennel!

name: Zoey Catalaya Bleu
description_html:
Meet Zoey Catalaya Bleu! 


Yes, her name is as big as her personality — and those “crazy eyes” will steal your heart in seconds. Zoey Catalaya Bleu is a 2-year-old, 25-pound pug mix who’s been in and out of the shelter through no fault of her own. The bright side? She already has experience living in a home and knows what cozy life can look like.


This sweet girl walks nicely on leash and loves exploring the play yard, especially when there are good smells to investigate.


Zoey would love a family ready to give her stability, love, and plenty of playtime. With her charm, curiosity, and pint-sized energy, she’s sure to bring joy wherever she goe

name: Socks
description_html:
Meet Socks 🧦💙


Socks is a wiggly little sweetheart who’s finding shelter life a bit overwhelming. Even though the world feels big and scary right now, he can’t help but wag his stubby tail whenever someone talks kindly to him — it’s his way of saying, “I want to trust you.”


Socks would love a patient, loving family who will give him the time and reassurance he needs to feel safe. With gentle guidance, consistency, and lots of love, he’ll blossom into a confident, happy companion. He’s the kind of dog who will form a deep bond with his people and remind you how powerful kindness can be.


If you have a soft voice, a calm home, and room in your heart for a dog who just needs to know he’s safe and loved, Socks is ready to be your loyal little shadow 🐾💛
